<!-- link1 "<U>EXPLANATORY NOTE</U>" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="000"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>EXPLANATORY NOTE</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to our Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarterly period ended September
30, 2006, as originally filed on November&nbsp;8, 2006, is being filed solely to file Exhibits 10.13,
10.14 and 10.15 as exhibits thereto and to amend the Exhibit&nbsp;Index included in Item&nbsp;6 of Part&nbsp;II to
add the new exhibits. An amended list of exhibits, including the new exhibits, is set forth below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Except as described above, no other changes have been made to the Report. This Amendment No.&nbsp;1 does
not update any other disclosures to reflect developments since the original date of filing.
</DIV>
<!-- link2 "ITEM 6. EXHIBITS" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="001"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>ITEM 6. EXHIBITS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(a)&nbsp;The exhibits listed on the Exhibit&nbsp;Index immediately following the signature page of this
Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q/A are filed as part of this report.
</DIV>
<!-- link1 "SIGNATURES" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="002"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SIGNATURES</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pursuant to the requirements of Section&nbsp;13 or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned,
thereunto duly authorized on December&nbsp;29, 2006.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 48%"><U><I>Allis-Chalmers Energy Inc.</I></U>

    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">10.14*
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Amendment No.&nbsp;1 dated May&nbsp;18, 2005 to Strategic Agreement between Pan American Energy LLC
Sucursal Argentina and DLS Argentina Limited Sucursal Argentina.</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.13
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>h42364exv10w13.htm
<DESCRIPTION>STRATEGIC AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w13</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.13
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>INTRODUCTION</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pan American Energy LLC (Sucursal Argentina), an oil and natural gas production company that
operates several areas within the Gulf of San Jorge in the Republic of Argentina (&#147;PAE&#148;) and DLS
Argentina Limited &#150; Sucursal Argentina, a company specialized in the drilling and completion of oil
wells and in the rendering of other services related therewith (&#147;DLS&#148;), have decided by mutual
agreement to form a long term strategic alliance for the drilling of wells for the production of
oil and/or natural gas and for the carrying out of eventual workover activities, declaring to
pursue the following purpose:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To drill as many wells as possible, of a quality that suits the needs of Pan
American, under the required safety, health and environment protection conditions and at
a cost convenient for both parties against different market conditions.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">To that end the parties intend:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To plan, jointly and in the long term, the best and most rational use of the equipment
available;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To promote the integration and development of both companies&#146; personnel in order to achieve
the most efficient performance of such personnel;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To permanently optimize the levels of operational excellency; and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#149;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To harmonize both companies Security, Health, Environment and Management systems by
defining common processes in order to rationalize such systems and make them more efficient for the
achievement of the proposed goals.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For the purpose of executing this proposal, the parties agree to remain subject to the model
agreement transcribed in the following chapter.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>EXHIBIT &#147;A&#148;</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>MODEL AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">City of Buenos Aires, July&nbsp;1, 2003.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Messrs.<BR>
<B>Pan American Energy LLC Sucursal Argentina</B><BR>
Av. Leandro N. Alem 1180<BR>
(1001)&nbsp;Buenos Aires<BR>
<U>By hand</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-top: 12pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; background: transparent; color: #000000">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD></TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left">Re:</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Strategic Agreement for the rendering of Drilling, Completion and Workover Services of oil
and gas wells</B></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear Sirs,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We hereby submit to your consideration our sole Strategic Agreement proposal for the rendering of
Drilling, Completion and Workover Services of wells located in the area of the Gulf of San Jorge,
Provinces of Chubut and Santa Cruz, and other services related therewith, as such services may be
requested by Pan American Energy LLC (Sucursal Argentina) according to its operation needs; the
text of the Strategic Agreement is transcribed herein below:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS, for the performance of its activities in the Gulf of San Jorge, PAE (as this term is
defined below) requires the performance of Drilling, Completion and Workover services of wells and
other services related therewith;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS DLS (as this term is defined below) is familiar with the rendering of drilling, completion
and workover services of oil wells and with the rendering of other services related therewith, it
has the necessary know-how and experience, capacity and availability to perform such services and
it also has experienced personnel and sufficient equipment to do so;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS DLS has economic and financial capacity to perform the services and to that effect wishes
to render the services to PAE (as this term is defined below);
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS it is the PARTIES intention to formalize a collaboration relationship based on
institutional trust;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS it is the PARTIES intention to work together in order to achieve mutual benefits by
developing ongoing improvements and optimizing the use of the resources;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS by implementing a long term Strategic Agreement the PARTIES shall be able to optimize the
use of the resources; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;WHEREAS by means of such long term Strategic Agreement, both DLS and PAE shall be able to obtain
mutual benefits in different areas both economic as well as operational and managerial;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">THEREFORE the PARTIES agree to execute a Strategic Agreement (hereinafter referred to as &#147;the
Agreement&#148;) subject to the following terms:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>1. PARTIES</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">DLS Argentina Limited &#150; Sucursal Argentina, with legal domicile at Av. Pueyrred&#243;n 1770,
4<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Floor of the City of Buenos Aires, hereinafter referred to as &#147;DLS&#148; and PAN
AMERICAN ENERGY LLC &#150; Sucursal Argentina, with legal domicile at Av. Leandro N. Alem 1180 of
the City of Buenos Aires, hereinafter referred to as &#147;PAE&#148; (both parties jointly referred to as
the &#147;PARTIES&#148; and individually as &#147;PARTY&#148;).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>2. PURPOSE</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The purpose of this Agreement is for DLS to perform the necessary works for the rendering of
drilling, completion and workover services of wells located in the area of the Gulf of San
Jorge, in the provinces of Chubut and Santa Cruz and other related services, as such services
are more thoroughly described in Appendix&nbsp;II of this Agreement (hereinafter, the &#147;SERVICES&#148;);
this description of the purpose shall not be construed to exclude other works contributing to
or related with the purposes of this Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>3. RENDERING OF THE SERVICES</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The Services that constitute the subject matter of this Agreement shall be rendered exclusively
to the extent to which they are required by PAE and in the amount determined by the latter, in
accordance with the guidelines set forth by section 4 below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The services shall be performed by DLS taking into consideration the conditions established in
this Agreement and its Appendixes (all of them hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Documents of the
Agreement&#148;), composed by the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Appendix&nbsp;I: Prices
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Appendix&nbsp;II: Technical Appendix
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Appendix&nbsp;III: PAE&#146;s General Bidding Terms and Conditions Applicable to Works and
Services Agreements. Subcontractors management SSA system. (both documents
hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Bidding Terms&#148;).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>4. AMOUNT OF EQUIPMENT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">DLS shall guarantee the availability of at least three (3)&nbsp;pieces of drilling equipment, eight
(8)&nbsp;pieces of workover equipment and five (5)&nbsp;pieces of light pulling equipment in order to
satisfy PAE requirements; in turn and provided there are no significant changes in the oil
price or adverse results different from the production estimations, PAE shall make available to
DLS a sufficient number or sites so as to permanently maintain all of the said equipment in
operation during the term of the Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">There are no limitations on the maximum amount of equipment to be provided by DLS, provided
however that the equipment is required by PAE.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The PARTIES agree to notify the other party at least thirty (30)&nbsp;days in advance prior to
requesting that the party adds or removes a piece of equipment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>5. TERM</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">This Agreement shall be in force for a period of five (5)&nbsp;years as from its Effective Date and
shall remain in force until the completion of the referred term, date on which it shall be
automatically terminated without any prior notice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The above referred term, however, shall be subject to the early termination provisions set
forth by the Documents of the Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>6. PRICE</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">See Appendix&nbsp;I.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>7. CERTIFICATION</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">DLS shall use the electronic work certification system contained in PAE&#146;s operative accounting
system called &#147;LABS&#148;, which consists on the generation of work certificates called &#147;<I>work
tickets</I>&#148; based on daily reports, and which DLS shall cause the team leader to enter through a
computer terminal; the work tickets shall be electronically delivered to the Agreement leader
for approval and subsequent preparation of an invoice. On the basis of the work tickets
approved by the Agreement leader, DLS shall prepare and present the invoices, which shall be
payable in accordance with section 8 &#147;Way of Payment&#148;. In the cases of Work Over and Pulling,
DLS shall present up to a maximum of one invoice per week.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>8. WAY OF PAYMENT</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">8.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Thirty (30)&nbsp;days following the electronic entry into the e-commerce system LABS of an
invoice duly documented as provided by Section&nbsp;7 above; within 24 hours DLS shall, at its
own option, deliver a hard copy of the invoice to Buenos Aires or to the Gulf of San Jorge
Management Unit.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">8.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>At PAE&#146;s request, DLS shall provide PAE with all the documentation required by the
Bidding Terms prior to the payment of invoices. In case PAE objected an invoice, PAE shall
pay the non-objected portion of the same and shall notify DLS about the objected items.
The objection shall only be acceptable if made on the basis of calculation errors or
errors in the preparation of the invoice.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">8.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A payment made by PAE shall in no way imply acceptance of the amendment to the
invoice and shall not mean a waiver to any right or recourse PAE may be entitled to under
this Agreement according to the law.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>9. DLS TAX IDENTIFICATION NUMBER</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">30-64074560-2
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>10. NECESSARY DOCUMENTS</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Regardless of the document requirements established by the Bidding Terms, which PAE may request
at any time, DLS shall keep in its possession the documents described below regarding all of
the personnel appointed to fulfill the Agreement (including its own subcontractors&#146; personnel)
and shall keep such documents permanently updated during the entire term of the Agreement:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Copy of their ID.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Work permits issued by the National Immigration Office in the case of foreign
employees. DLS hereby represents that it is aware of the provisions of Section&nbsp;71 of Act
17.319 and committed to complying with them.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Updated certificates of social security contributions.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Registration of the personnel with a Labor Risk Insurance Company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(e)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Medical center specialized in labor medicine assisting all personnel appointed to
fulfill the Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(f)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Receipts for working clothes and personal safety items signed by all personnel
appointed to fulfill the Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(g)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>List of vehicles and/or road equipment and insurances, as required by the Bidding
Terms, corresponding to the company that will transport DLS personnel and to DLS fleet of
vehicles.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(h)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drivers license of DLS personnel and of the personnel of the company that will
transport DLS personnel.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">PAE may at any time perform an audit and request the above described documents; in case PAE
verified that there is no objective evidence about the existence of such documents, its shall
proceed in accordance with the provisions of the Bidding Terms.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The PARTIES undertake to comply at every time with the labor, health and safety, insurance and
social security provisions set forth by the national, provincial and local legislation, as well
as with their internal corporate regulations, which they declare to know.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>11. INSURANCES</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">DLS shall provide PAE with a copy of the insurance policies signed by the insurance company and
executed in accordance with the provisions of the Bidding Terms or the equivalent certificates
issued by the insurance company, with the specifications described hereunder:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The <B>General Civil Liability </B>Insurance shall be executed for an amount of
US$1,000,000.00 per claim and shall include, in addition to the ordinary provisions
contained in this type of policy</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Specific reference to the fact that the policy covers damages eventually caused to
landowners who are not a party to the Agreement during the fulfillment of the same.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Extension of the coverage to whatever amounts DLS had to pay as a result of damages to
elements or goods that were in its possession under any legal title, or under its
supervision, even if such elements or goods were used by DLS in carrying out its duties but
they were the property of PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Inclusion of PAE as a third party covered by the insurance policy.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Neither DLS nor the insurance company shall be entitled to exercise any compensation or
reimbursement rights against PAE for any damages or losses to DLS or PAE&#146;s goods which had
been used in order to fulfill this Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>12. ASSIGNMENT OF THE AGREEMENT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Taking into consideration the nature of the Agreement and the relationship between the PARTIES,
none of the PARTIES may assign the Agreement, in part or as a whole, nor may DLS subcontract
all or part of the works that constitute the subject matter of the same, without prior written
authorization by the other PARTY. For the purposes of the Agreement, all of the obligations of
DLS shall be deemed to be also its subcontractors obligations and DLS shall be jointly and
severally responsible with them for damages caused to PAE, even when PAE had authorized the
subcontracting.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The section above shall not apply in case the assignment by PAE was part of a greater
transaction (internationally known as a &#147;<I>package deal</I>&#148;), resulting either from a spin off,
merger, sale of all or of a substantial part of PAE&#146;s rights or assets and only in the event
that the assignment of the Agreement by PAE represented less than 30% (thirty percent) of the
value of the said greater transaction.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>13. FORCE MAJEURE</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">None of the PARTIES shall be liable for failing to comply with the terms of the Agreement when
compliance with its obligation was impeded, prevented or delayed by an extraordinary event
constituting an event of force majeure or Act of God according to sections 513/514 of the Civil
Code. Each PARTY shall give the other party notice of the occurrence of such events within
forty eight (48)&nbsp;hours following such occurrence and immediately after their disappearance in
order to resume the fulfillment of the Agreement. The PARTY affected by the event of force
majeure or Act of God shall make its best efforts to mitigate the effects of the same.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>14. RESPONSIBILITIES</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">14.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Responsibility for complying with the Laws of the Republic of Argentina. </B>DLS shall
perform all the works specified in the Agreement complying with all the laws and
regulations of the Republic of Argentina, any applicable geopolitical subdivision thereof,
including but not limited to the observance of the provisions related to the way the
operations should be conducted and to the employer&#146;s obligations regarding safety,
salaries, social security contributions and insurances in connection with its own or its
subcontractors personnel. DLS further undertakes to maintain and immediately communicate
PAE about, and to hold PAE harmless against any claim, penalty, lawsuit or action of any
nature based on laws, regulations or bargaining agreements that may be applicable as a
result of the operations performed under the Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>15. APPENDIXES THAT FORM PART OF THE AGREEMENT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Appendixes I, II and III (Prices, Technical Appendix and Bidding Terms) shall be regarded as
part of the Agreement as if they were incorporated in the body of the same.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">In case of conflict between the provisions of the Agreement and the provisions of the
Appendixes, however, or between the Appendixes themselves, the Agreement shall prevail over the
Appendixes and an Appendix shall prevail over the other ones according to the order in which
they are listed in the present section.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>16. HEADINGS &#150; INDIVISIBLE AGREEMENT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The headings preceding each section are included for the purpose of facilitating their reading
only and shall not be used to interpret the Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the PARTIES and supersedes all prior
agreement or communication, and may only be amended through a document executed by the
authorized representatives of the PARTIES.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>17. INDEMNITY</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">17.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

this Agreement, shall have the following meanings:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Affiliate&#148; of a PARTY means an individual or entity who directly or
indirectly controls such PARTY, is controlled by such PARTY o is controlled by the
same individual or entity controlling such PARTY. For the purpose of the present
definition, the term control means direct or indirect ownership by the controlling
entity of fifty percent (50%) or more of the capital stock or participating interest
and of the voting rights of or in the controlled entity, or the capacity to direct
the management of such PARTY. In the events of indirect ownership of capital stock
or participating interest and voting rights, the above referred minimum percentage
required must be verified among the Bidder, the Subcontractor or the Company and
each of the individuals, entities, companies or associations involved in the chain
of control.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;COMPANY GROUP&#148; is formed by the following individuals and entities,
either individually or collectively considered: PAE and its Affiliates, its partners
and its Affiliates and the directors, executives, employees, agents and insurance
companies of such entities.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;CONTRACTOR GROUP&#148; is formed by the following individuals and
entities, either individually or collectively considered: DLS and its Affiliates,
its subcontractors and its Affiliates and the directors, executives, employees,
agents and insurance companies of such entities.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The &#147;THIRD PARTIES&#148; are all individuals and entities not included neither
in the COMPANY GROUP nor in the CONTRACTOR GROUP.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

policies limits (if the latter were lower than the amounts actually claimed), in the

by the CONTRACTOR GROUP, taking into account that in the event of concurring negligence or

negligence.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">It is the PARTIES intention that, to the extent that it is permitted by the applicable

lawsuit, liability, damage or expenses in question (a)&nbsp;are based or not on negligence,
extra-contractual responsibility, obligations established by law, or contractual compensations
or (b)&nbsp;are directly or indirectly claimed by any individual or entity against the CONTRACTOR
GROUP or the COMPANY GROUP by way of exercising reimbursement, compensation or contribution
actions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">when the same are originated or result from negligence, gross negligence or willful

gross negligence.

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">It is the PARTIES intention that, to the extent that it is permitted by the applicable
legislation, the compensations prescribed by this Section&nbsp;17.3 are applied either if the
lawsuit, liability, damage or expenses in question (a)&nbsp;are based or not on negligence,
extra-contractual responsibility, obligations established by law, or contractual
compensations or (b)&nbsp;are directly or indirectly claimed by any individual or entity
against the CONTRACTOR GROUP or the

</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 6%">COMPANY
GROUP by way of exercising reimbursement, compensation or
contribution actions.</div>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">17.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The CONTRACTOR or the COMPANY, as the case may be, shall immediately give the other
PARTY notice of any lawsuit brought, or administrative or judicial action or claim filed
against it by virtue of which the CONTRACTOR or the COMPANY claim to be indemnified under
the terms of the present Agreement (hereinafter, a &#147;Claim&#148;). Such notice shall state as
comprehensively as possible the facts and circumstances originating the Claim and shall be
delivered to the other PARTY as soon as possible after the PARTY that received the Claim
(for the purposes of this Section&nbsp;17.4, the &#147;Indemnified Party&#148;) becomes aware of the
existence of the Claim. The PARTY that receives the notice from the Indemnified Party
(for the purposes of this Section&nbsp;17.4, the &#147;Indemnifying Party&#148;) shall meet with the
Indemnified Party in order to discuss the defense of such Claim, but the Indemnifying
Party or its insurance company, as the case may be, shall maintain control over such
defense, including but not limited to the selection and direction of its legal advisers.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, none of the PARTIES shall agree to any conciliation,
settlement or agreement, whether judicial or extrajudicial, regarding such Claim without
prior written consent by the other PARTY; taking into account that in the event that the
Indemnified Party did not consent to a conciliation, settlement or agreement that the
Indemnifying Party is willing to accept, the responsibility of the Indemnifying Party
shall be limited to the amount for which the Claim could have been settled. The
Indemnified Party may, in turn, by giving the Indemnifying Party notice and at the sole
cost and expense of the Indemnified Party, choose its own defense to challenge the Claim,
provided however that during the course of the discussions of the Claim such defense does
not carry out any action that harms the defense of such Claim.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">17.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>None of the PARTIES shall be responsible before the other PARTY for any kind of
indirect , punitive, special or consequential damages arising from or in any way related
to the present Agreement and each PARTY agrees to defend, indemnify and exempt the other
PARTY from such responsibility.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">17.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>(a)&nbsp;The CONTRACTOR GROUP shall be responsible for controlling and suppressing the
damages and shall defend, hold harmless and prevent the COMPANY GROUP from suffering any
damages arising from losses or damages claimed or lawsuits brought on the basis of
contamination originated in fuels, lubricants, motor oils, pipe grease, paint, dirt, waste
or any other substance produced by any equipment, instrument or tool used in the
performance of the SERVICES, or by the CONTRACTOR GROUP&#146;s equipment or material.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>(b) The COMPANY GROUP shall be responsible for controlling and suppressing the damages
and shall defend, hold harmless and prevent the CONTRACTOR GROUP from suffering any
damages arising from losses or damages claimed or lawsuits brought on the basis of
contamination caused by events not contained in Section&nbsp;17.6(a), including fire, blow
out, crack, leak or any other uncontrolled flow of oil, gas or well water occurred during
the operations which is not attributable to negligence or gross negligence by the
CONTRACTOR GROUP.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notwithstanding the PARTIES obligations under the provisions of section 13.2 of Appendix
II A, it is hereby agreed that in the event of a blow out, PAE shall be exclusively in
charge of the operations and shall be responsible for controlling and capping the well
either by itself or through subcontractors specialized in this type of operations. Except
in case the blow out resulted from gross negligence or willful misconduct by the
CONTRACTOR GROUP, the COMPANY GROUP shall be responsible for the damages or injuries
caused to THIRD PARTIES and to the CONTRACTOR GROUP or to their goods as a consequence of
the blow out, loss of control, damage and/or destruction of the well.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>18. BREACH OF CONTRACT</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Notwithstanding other rights held by PAE under the governing law or the Documents of the
Agreement, breach by DLS of any of its obligations, or late or inadequate fulfillment of such
obligations shall grant PAE the following rights, which shall be exercised prior notification
to DLS at least thirty (30)&nbsp;days in advance in order for DLS to remedy the breach within such
term:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>to retain any sums owed to DLS for any cause up to the amount necessary to remedy the
breach, either by itself or through subcontractors hired to that effect.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>to terminate the Agreement by operation of law after the expiration of the referred
term if the notified breach is not remedied.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">DLS obligations deriving from its performance in SSA, established in the Documents of the
Agreement, shall be deemed included in the DLS prime obligations described in this Section.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>19. JURISDICTION</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The PARTIES undertake to resolve their differences regarding the interpretation and execution
of this Agreement in good faith and under the principle of mutual cooperation, understanding
and consultation. To this effect, they shall hold the necessary meetings in order to resolve
their differences within thirty (30)&nbsp;days as from the moment such differences arise.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">For all the purposes of the present Agreement, the Bidding Terms and the Bidding
Specifications, and in the event the PARTIES were unable to resolve their differences in the
way and within the term specified above, the PARTIES agree to be subject to the Jurisdiction of
the competent Courts of the City of Buenos Aires and expressly waive any other competent
jurisdiction that may correspond.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><U><B>20. NOTICES</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Notices and other communications required under the present Agreement shall be given in writing
and shall be deemed sufficient for any purposes when received by hand, certified mail, courier
or fax, at the recipient&#146;s address established hereunder, (taking into consideration that any
of the PARTIES may change the address by giving notice) or when delivered by hand to the
authorized representative of the receiving PARTY. Each notice delivered by any of the ways
described above shall be effective on the effective date of reception by the receiving PARTY.
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX I &#150; PRICES</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The present Appendix&nbsp;I forms part of the &#147;Strategic Agreement for the rendering of Drilling,
Completion and Workover Services of oil and gas wells&#148; dated July&nbsp;1, 2003 (hereinafter, the
&#147;Agreement&#148; or the &#147;Alliance&#148;). All capitalized terms that are not expressly defined by the present
instrument shall have the meaning assigned to them by the Agreement.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>1. INTRODUCTION</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The PARTIES acknowledge that the compensation scheme described below has been designed by
mutual agreement for the purpose of facilitating the achievement of the goals set for the
Alliance and, to this effect, such scheme may be revised and amended at the request of any of
the PARTIES, on the basis that the operation practices and/or a change in the external
conditions during the term of the Agreement reveal a discrepancy between the intended results
and the results actually achieved.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Likewise, at any time during the term of the Agreement any PARTY may propose any amendment to
the present compensation scheme that might reinforce the effective achievement of the intended
goals.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">In any case, the proposed amendments shall require both PARTIES approval in order to be
incorporated to the Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>2. QUOTATION CURRENCY AND ADJUSTMENT FOR INFLATION</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>2.1. Mixed Unit</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The prices contained in the present Appendix&nbsp;I are expressed in Mixed Units, hereinafter MU; a
MU is a currency unit defined for the sole purpose of facilitating the management of the prices
of the Agreement.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">
MU result from directly adding the amounts in US Dollars (USD)&nbsp;and in legal tender Argentine
Pesos ($) in which any price may be broken down according to the PARTIES agreement. Therefore
MU shall become completely defined by identifying the USD proportion in each MU, since the
remaining complementary part corresponds to $.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">
The corresponding complete notation shall be: MU(X%USD), which means that every MU shall be
composed of X% USD and (100-X)% $.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">
For the purpose of clarifying the meaning and application of the MU, the following two examples
may be used:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Case 1: 100 MU(30%USD) are equivalent to USD30 &#043; $70<BR>
Case 2: 200 MU (60%USD) are equivalent to USD120 &#043; $80
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">In this Agreement, when a price is expressed in MU(X%USD), the amount corresponding to USD
shall be referred to as USD Portion and the amount corresponding to $ shall be referred to as $
Portion.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">In the examples above, in the first case the USD Portion is 30 and the $ Portion is 70; in the
second case, the USD Portion is 120 and the $ Portion is 80.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>2.2. Ii Adjustment Index</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">For the purposes of attenuating the significant variations on profitability that
inflation/deflation processes may impose on contracts executed on the basis of fixed prices,
the Parties agree to review and eventually adjust the different prices and tariffs contained in
the present Appendix&nbsp;I on a monthly basis, by using the Ii Adjustment Index; the Index general
calculation way and application procedure are the following:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.2.1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Ii Adjustment Index corresponding to the &#147;i&#148; period shall be calculated on a
monthly basis according to the following formula:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

for inflation.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.2.5.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The variables selected to design the Adjustment Index as well as their respective
coefficients A, B and C regarding each particular tariff may be replaced by new variables
and coefficient values provided the Parties agree to do so.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>3. COMPENSATION SCHEME</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1. Drilling Service</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Compensation to be paid by PAE to DLS for the drilling service rendered in accordance with the
scope, terms and conditions of the Agreement and its Appendixes shall be subject to the
following scheme:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1.1. </B><U><B>Wells between 900 and 2,700 mts. depth / Conventional drilling</B></U>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The drilling of wells whose final depth is between 900 and 2,700 mts. and which have been
drilled by using the standard methodology specified in Appendix&nbsp;II, or by using
methodologies previously tested and adopted by the PARTIES by mutual agreement and which
therefore cannot be termed as &#147;tests&#148; (hereinafter, &#147;Conventional Drilling&#148;), shall be
compensated according to the following formula:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 9%; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>LS = K x TStd</I></B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B><I>LS </I></B><I>= Lump Sum </I>&#091;MU(30%USD)&#093;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B><I>K </I></B>= Standard Hourly Rate = 847.00 MU (30%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B><I>T</I></B><I>Std </I>= Standard drilling Time measured in hours, which shall be determined on the basis of
the final depth of the completed well <B><I>TD </I></B>expressed in meters using the notation:
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 9%; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>TStd =</I></B><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom"> </SUB><Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i x119x<B><I>EXP</I></B>(0.00044x<B><I>TD</I></B>)</SUB>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">where <Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i</SUB> is the efficiency applicable to the period &#145;i&#146; for which the Standard
Time is being calculated. The <Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i</SUB> efficiency shall be recalculated every 6&nbsp;months
as from the effective date of the Agreement using the notation:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="30%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="10%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="52%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD align=right valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px"><Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i = </SUB><Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i-1 x </SUB>{1- &#091;(1-
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><Font face="symbol">&#229;</Font> T<SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">Real</SUB>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">)x 0.5&#093;}</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">&nbsp;
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><Font face="symbol">&#229;</Font> T<SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">Std(i-1)</SUB></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">&nbsp;
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><DIV style="font-size: 1pt; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B><Font face="symbol">&#229;</Font> T</B><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom"><B>Real</B></SUB> is the summation of the time actually used in the drilling of all the
wells carried out during the past 12&nbsp;months of operation.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><Font face="symbol">&#229;</Font> T <SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">Std(i-1)</SUB> is the summation of the time anticipated by the function <B><I>TStd </I></B>in
effect during the period immediately prior to the period for which the efficiency is being
calculated, applied to the same wells as referred above.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><Font face="symbol">&#104;</Font><SUB style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-bottom">i-1</SUB> is the efficiency corresponding to the immediately previous period. It is
hereby established that the efficiency corresponding to the initial 6&nbsp;months period equals
1 (one).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">For the purposes of the present section, the referred drilling times comprise as from the
beginning of the dismantling of the equipment at one site up to the beginning of the
dismantling of the equipment at the next site, including transport time from one site to
the other one.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1.2. </B><U><B>Wells over 2,700 mts. depth and TESTS</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Wells of a projected final depth exceeding 2,700m or wells in which the PARTIES decide
to use technologies or procedures as TESTS shall be compensated through the Hourly Rate
plus reimbursable costs system.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>TNP </I></B>is the Net Drilling Time measured in hours as from the well spuding up to the
completion of the works and dismantling of the equipment; the amount PAE shall pay DLS
in order to compensate the use of the drilling equipment shall be calculated as the
result of <B><I>TNP </I></B>x <B><I>OHR</I></B>, where:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>OHR </I></B>= Operation Hourly Rate = 541.50 MU(37%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">The materials and services actually employed during the drilling and not included in
the equipment&#146;s hourly compensation shall be reimbursed by PAE to DLS at the
presentation of the corresponding expenses vouchers or through the use of unit price
lists approved by the PARTIES in due time.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Such materials and services comprise, among others: DTA, Drill Bits, Mud Materials,
Water Transport, Rents, etc.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1.3. </B><U><B>Deepenings exceeding 2,700 mts. depth</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">In case of deepenings exceeding 2,700m for all types of wells having an original final
depth of less than 2,700m, the total compensation shall be calculated as the summation
of the LS (<I>Lump Sum</I>) corresponding to 2,700m, calculated as described in 2.1.1, plus
the amount resulting of applying the Hourly Rate plus Reimbursable Costs system defined
in 2.1.2, applied as from 2,700m depth up to the completion of the well.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1.4. </B><U><B>Stand By Rate</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">The Stand By Rate applicable as provided for by the Technical Appendix shall be:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>SHO </I></B>= Stand By Hourly Rate = 498.18 MU(37%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.1.5. </B><U><B>Coefficients for calculating the Adjustment Index</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">The values of the A, B and C coefficients as defined in 2.2.1 applicable to all rates
detailed in 3.1 are:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

</TD>

    <TD align="left" valign="top">0.35</TD>
</TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">B =

<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.2. Completion and Workover service</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Compensation to be paid to DLS for the Completion and Workover service rendered in
accordance with the scope, terms and conditions of the Agreement and its Appendixes shall
be:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.2.1. </B><U><B>Operation Hourly Rate</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">The hourly rate that shall be used to compensate the use of Completion equipment shall
be:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>OHR </I></B>= Operation Hourly Rate = 276.50 MU(19%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.2.2. </B><U><B>Stand By and Climate Factor Hourly Rate</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">The Stand By and Climate Factor Hourly Rate applicable as provided for by the Technical
Appendix shall be:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>SHR </I></B>= Stand By Hourly Rate = 253.55 MU(19%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%"><B><I>CFHR </I></B>= Climate Factor Hourly Rate = 138.25 MU(19%USD)/hour
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%"><B>3.2.3. </B><U><B>DTA Rate</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">Compensation that PAE shall pay DLS for the Dismantling, Transport and Assemblage (DTA)
of Completion equipment shall be:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">DTA(=f) = DTA between wells located on the same flange = 4,012.20 MU(19%USD) &#043;
&#091;Distance in excess of 20Km&#093; x 59.44 MU(19%USD)/Km
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 5%">DTA(<FONT style="font-family: symbol">&#185;</FONT>f) = DTA between wells located on different flanges = 10,818.08 MU(19%USD)
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX II: TECHNICAL APPENDIX</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>II.A &#150; DRILLING IN THE GULF OF SAN JORGE </U><BR>
<U>MANAGEMENT UNIT</U>

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The present Appendix&nbsp;II.A forms part of the &#147;Strategic Agreement for the rendering of Drilling,
Completion and Workover Services of oil and gas wells&#148; executed between DLS and PAE (in this
Appendix, hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Agreement&#148; or the &#147;Alliance&#148;). All capitalized terms that
are not expressly defined by the present Appendix shall have the meaning assigned to them by the
Agreement.
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX II: TECHNICAL APPENDIX</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>II.A &#150; DRILLING OF WELLS IN THE GULF OF SAN JORGE </U><BR>
<U>MANAGEMENT UNIT</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">SECTION 1<BR>
LOCATION OF THE WELLS.

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The sites designed and provided by PAE shall be located within the area of the Gulf of San Jorge
Management Unit, which comprise the areas of Cerro Drag&#243;n, Anticlinal Grande and Anticlinal Funes
corresponding to the North flange and Piedra Clavada and Koluel Kaike corresponding to the South
flange.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 2<BR>
PERFORMANCE OF THE WORKS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall begin and carry on the operations with due diligence and without improper delays or
interruptions and shall perform such operations on the basis of a seven (7)-days-week and twenty
four (24)-hours-working days.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If an unplanned interruption of the operations extends for a period exceeding 30&nbsp;days, DLS shall
provide a replacement; planned interruptions shall be communicated by DLS two months in advance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In order to ensure the fulfillment of the technical requirements established in the present
Appendix and maintain control over the processes affecting the standards of Quality and Safety set
with respect to the contractual obligations, for the purposes of the Alliance, the Quality Plan
(PG-AE-GC-02) is hereby implemented. This Quality Plan describes the way in which the requirements
of the Agreement are fulfilled and contains the description of how operations are carried out, also
referring to the applicable procedures and instructions to that effect.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 3<BR>
DEPTHS AND DIAMETER.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>General provisions.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Wells shall drilled up to final depths between 900 and 2,700 meters.<BR><br>
PAE reserves the right to complete the drilling at a greater or lower depth in accordance
with the provisions of the present bidding terms.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Minimum depth of the wells.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event that a well is abandoned at PAE&#146;s request and not as a result of improper
performance by DLS or malfunction of its equipment, at a depth lower than 900 meters, PAE
shall compensate DLS with the Hourly Rate for the amount of time employed in assembling the
drilling equipment, drilling the well, abandoning the well, dismantling the equipment and
transporting the same to the next well or to the base.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case it was necessary to drill a well to a depth exceeding 2,700 meters, DLS consent shall
be required. The drilling equipment provided by DLS shall have a nominal drilling capacity of
3,000 meters.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Diameter of the Wells.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The project well shall be drilled with drill bits of 12 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; up to a depth between 100 and
500 meters and cased with casing of 9 5/8&#148; O.D. The rest of well shall be drilled with
drill bits of 8 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; &#150; 8 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>3</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; and shall be cased with casing of 5 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; O.D.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In some cases the following shall be necessary:<br><br>
a) to start the well with drill bits of 17 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; and case with casing of 13 3/8&#148;.<br><br>
b) to case the insulation span with casing of 7&#148; O.D.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 4<BR>
TARIFFS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>General provisions</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall pay DLS for the services rendered on the basis of the tariffs established in
Appendix&nbsp;I of the Agreement and the ones defined herein below:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Waiting Hourly Rate (WHR)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate shall be applied when the continuance of the drilling works is delayed at PAE&#146;s
instruction due to the fact that PAE is waiting for instructions, materials, locations,
roads and other circumstances to be defined and which do not constitute an event of force
majeure or Act of God. PAE may decide to put one or more pieces of equipment &#147;on hold&#148; and
during such period DLS shall be paid the Waiting Hourly Rate. There are no time limitations
with respect to &#147;on hold&#148; situations and the equipment may remain assembled on the well, on
the Oilfield or at DLS&#146;s yard while such situations remain.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Conventional Drilling Rate</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The conventional drilling rate shall be applicable to all drilling operations of regular
wells between 900 and 2,700 meters (See<BR>
Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices &#150;Section&nbsp;2.1.1).<br><br>
The depths shall be determined by the measurement of the drill pipes through the use of
steel tape.<br><br>
All these measurements shall be taken from the kelly drive bushing and the distance in
meters between the bushing and the ground level shall be deducted from the calculation.
The provision of drill bits, water and mud materials shall be DLS&#146; responsibility.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Operation Hourly Rate (OHR)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This hourly rate shall be applicable during the performance of wells of a programmed final
depth exceeding 2,700 meters. The same rate shall be applicable to the drilling of test
wells as provided by the PG-AE-PF-01 Alliance Procedure. In both cases the DTA shall be
charged in accordance with Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices, Section&nbsp;2.1 Price List.<br><br>
The provision of drill bits, water and injection materials shall be PAE&#146;s responsibility.
With respect to the OHR, PAE shall recognize up to 15 minutes per each eight hour shift, up
to a maximum of forty five minutes per day for maintenance and equipment repair works.<BR>
<BR>

Greater costs associated with additional works required to be carried out due to equipment
malfunctions shall be shared by the parties on the basis of the determining causes of such
malfunction and the parties corresponding responsibilities.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 5<BR>
MATERIALS, SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT, SERVICES, PERSONNEL, ETC. TO BE PROVIDED BY DLS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall provide the main and auxiliary equipment necessary to comply with the work schedule. In
particular, the drilling equipment shall have a nominal drilling capacity of 3,000 meters and shall
meet the API standards. Likewise, PAE&#146;s &#147;Wells Operation and Drilling Policies&#148; shall be observed
where applicable.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE reserves the right to expressly accept an amount of equipment not strictly suitable to fulfill
this condition according to its drilling program.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, PAE requires at least the following:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Application of the &#147;Technical and Basic Safety Rules for Drilling Operations&#148;
(PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure) for the PAE-DLS Strategic Alliance.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Check list to verify the fulfillment of the PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Dismantling, Transport and Assemblage of Tower Equipment Safety (PG-AE-SE-01 Procedure).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Trucks and hoisting elements Certification and Audit Procedure (IT-AE-TR-05).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">5.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Equipment</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">5.1.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling equipment:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
