</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall provide the casing tong service at PAE&#146;s entire satisfaction. In case this
service does not meet the required safety or technical standards, PAE may require DLS to
hire a Company approved by PAE to perform the service and the resulting costs shall be
borne by DLS.
In case this situation was verified again, PAE may require that a Company approved by PAE
provides this service on a permanent basis and the resulting costs shall be borne by DLS.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">5.1.5 Tools:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Weight, penetration, pump pressure and torque , RPM, strokes per minute and stroke
counter indicators.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Deviation meter. At PAE&#146;s request and free of charge DLS shall make available at
the C. Rivadavia base a Mathey type wire winch.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All the tools required to control the drilling processes and the tools to control the
quality of the mud shall be comprehended within the calibration and tools control ISO
procedure agreed in the Alliance.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">5.1.6 Fishing tools
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Safety glasses for all personnel.</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Ear protectors to use at all places where noise level exceeds 85 decibels.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In vehicles or fixed premises, personnel shall wear the gear
prescribed by the corresponding Safety Regulations.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Electronic speed recorder in vehicles (digital speed meter)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition, all other gear required by legal regulations in force</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">5.7</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Three dry chemical powder ABC type, potassium base, fire trucks of 100 Kg.
capacity or three dry chemical powder fire trucks of 70 Kg. capacity.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Six dry chemical powder ABC type, potassium base, manual extinguishers of 10
Kg. capacity or six dry chemical powder manual extinguishers of 7 Kg. capacity.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All the equipment described in a. and b. above shall be nitrogen pressurized
and have a pressure control gauge.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">d.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Two carbon dioxide extinguishers of 5 Kg. capacity each.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">e.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The equipment shall be placed at strategic places. The trucks shall not be
over 20 meters away from the drilling equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">f.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition, all other equipment required by legal regulations in force.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">g.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The team shall hold safety meetings once a week (each shift) during free
working time.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

training issues shall be kept.</TD>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 6<BR>
MATERIALS, SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT, SERVICES, PERSONNEL, ETC. TO BE PROVIDED BY<BR>
PAE.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE shall provide the following services and materials:

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</TR>

    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Wire line service, including indication of the free point and breakout. In case of
fishing attributable to DLS, DLS shall provide such services at its own cost, if required.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Water supply</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall make available loading points conveniently located within the working area in
order to guarantee the supply of water during drilling operations.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The water used in the operations, either salt or fresh water, shall be carried by DLS.
The cost of such transport shall be included in the conventional Drilling tariff according
to Section&nbsp;4.3.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall indicate the loading racks where water can be obtained.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall take the necessary measures to rationalize the use of water and, if possible, use
mud in tank cleaning.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall raise its personnel awareness in order to minimize the volumes of wasted water
for different reasons, such as centrifugal pump packing condition, state of hoses and
joints, avoiding overflows, etc.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Surface works.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3">PAE shall provide the following surface works, duly completed, for the wells to be drilled:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Completed compacted and properly leveled site in the assemblage area,
equipment anchorage (&#147;Site Construction Procedures&#148; PG-AE-FA-01).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Derrick cellar and conductor pipe.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Mud pit for injection.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Access road to location.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Road and access to water loading racks.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 7<BR>
DRILLING METHODS AND PRACTICES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Due diligence.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall commence the works on the date indicated by PAE and shall continue to perform
them with due diligence and care, in accordance with good oilfields practices, keeping the
equipment in optimum working conditions and using competent personnel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall employ all necessary care and diligence (in particular but not limited to, the
closure of valves), in order to avoid contamination of the phreatic layers, the
deterioration of the land, field, livestock, premises and, in general, in order to avoid
damages to PAE and to third parties. The protection of the environment shall be governed by
the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, certified by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Required quality</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.2.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Caliper within the zone of interest:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall monitor the process so that the caliper diameter within the zone of
interest is not higher than 9&#148; or lower than 8 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; (with &#043;1/4&#148; / -0 tolerance),
avoiding caves and surface rugosity affecting the data recording quality of the
logging tools. All records exceeding the specified limits (process control range)
shall be analyzed and the causes of such circumstances shall be identified and deemed
as a lesson for the application of counter-measures in new wells.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.2.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Hole deviation</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall take the necessary measures, according to good drilling practices used in
oilfields, so that the well is not deflected beyond the following limits:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A maximum of two (2)&nbsp;degrees beyond the vertical for each fifty (50)&nbsp;meters.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A maximum of one and a half (1.5) degrees from the wellhead to the total
depth of the guide pipe.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A maximum of four (4)&nbsp;degrees from guide pipe shoe to the final depth of the
well.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall measure the deviation from the vertical at each drill bit change or when
the drilling schedule so requires, by using adequate tools in accordance with the ISO
Tools Calibration and Control procedure.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>
The resulting values shall be verified every time dip meter surveys are performed.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.2.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Water loss at the zone of interest</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A water loss value of 8cc/30min. (API)&nbsp;is hereby established as an empirical
reference for the Gulf of San Jorge. This value may be revised and controlled tests
under the (PG-AE-PF-01) procedure the optimum water loss value may be defined, so
that penetration speed may be maximized without affecting the caliper and minimizing
the damages to the formation.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.2.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling mud salinity</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Mud containing 3,000 ppm chloride ion by adding KCI shall be used at the zone of
interest.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.2.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling mud density</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The density value shall be the minimum possible value compatible with the well&#146;s
safety conditions.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purpose of minimizing the damage to the formation, a maximum % of solids of
7%-8% without increasing the density is hereby defined. The use of mud-weighting
materials shall be allowed only as an exception for problem wells or wells with
neighboring problem wells.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Controlled tests</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purpose of facilitating ongoing improvements to the drilling processes defined in
the Agreement, changes in the methodology, introduction of technologies, change of
practices, new mud formulas, etc. shall be carried out through Controlled Tests (according
to the PG-AE-PF-01 procedure) and the results shall determine the adoption or rejection of
the proposed changes.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The performance of these controlled tests shall be compensated under the OHR tariff
modality as provided for by Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices 2.1.2.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire and blow outs prevention</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall use all possible means to control and avoid fires and blow outs and
to protect the well. No fire shall be allowed within a 50 meter perimeter around the
well. In case it was necessary to perform welding works on the equipment or in the
surrounding area, an &#147;authorization to perform hot working&#148; from the representative in
the Area (Team Leader).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The B.O.P. shall be placed in the 9 5/8&#148; guide pipe during all drilling
operations and shall be kept in optimum working conditions. In this respect, DLS shall
examine and test the working conditions of the B.O.P. valves and other equipment
following each assemblage and record the results of such tests on the drilling
records.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall perform at its own expense well control simulations through well known
procedures; simulations shall involve all working shifts and shall be carried out
once for every well; the results shall be entered in the drilling records.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>B.O.P Tests</U></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Immediately following installation, test the rams, annulus,
Lines and flow manifold, according to DLS procedure.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Prior to commencing the drilling of the 8 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; diameter well
and completed the cement setting time, the guide pipe tightness and the
pipe-B.O.P. connection shall be tested as indicated by the drilling schedule.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case it is necessary to replace parts of the B.O.P. or of
the surface equipment during the operations, the disassembled section shall be
tested again.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3">In addition, PAE may request the B.O.P. test at any time deemed convenient.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling Schedule</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #textcolor#; background: #bgcolor#">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Alliance Engineering Department shall prepare the drilling schedule for each well and 2
weeks in advance shall provide the Team Leader with the information regarding neighboring
wells with respect to layer pressures, loggings and lessons learned.</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Changes to the drilling schedule shall be authorized by the Alliance Leader.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall test the drilling mud at least every eight hours in order to verify its
properties and shall record the results of such tests in the DIMS with the same frequency
as well as every time changes of parameters are introduced. The API drilling mud report
shall be delivered to the Cerro Drag&#243;n of Koluel Kaike offices, as the case may be, on a
daily basis.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Use of DIMS to record mud and losses volumes.<BR>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>
Upon completion o the well, DLS shall deliver to the offices a summary of the materials
used, water consumption to prepare the mud and the equipment total water consumption
together with the rest of the documents related to the well. Water volumes shall be
recorded by zones in cases of loss by circulation.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall keep the well, pipe and annular spaces full of drilling mud at all times. The
change of drill bit jobs shall be controlled by using the trip tank and the trip
spreadsheet shall be kept in the files to evidence its use.<BR>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Prior to carrying out the round-trip operation, weight up mud pills (barite)&nbsp;shall be used
in the drill string in order to avoid mud losses and have better control over the filling
of the well.</TD>
</TR>


<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">7.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Depth records and drill string.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall maintain at all time accurate records of the following:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling depths by controlling the quantity and length of the drill string
lowered into the well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Dimensions and physical characteristics of all items lowered into the well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Changes to the drilling and drilling mud parameters.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 8<BR>
CASING.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE shall prepare the casing program. The maximum cement setting time for the guide pipe shall be
eight (8)&nbsp;hours. The guide pipe shall not be moved during the first eight (8)&nbsp;setting hours
unless PAE requests to reduce such time. In case PAE changes the diameter of the well or of the
casing and this change resulted in additional costs to DLS, the parties shall agree the
compensation amount.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 9<BR>
SAMPLES AND LOGGING.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">9.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Samples.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE may request cuttings samples at regular intervals during the drilling, which shall be
placed in bags provided by PAE. In addition, PAE may request the drilling to be interrupted
in order to circulate drilling mud and obtain such samples, which DLS shall take, wash,
identify, keep and preserve for PAE. The time spend during the performance of this service
shall be paid at the OHR tariff.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">9.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Logging.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall choose, at its own decision, one development well out of ten wells drilled, in
order to log the respective guiding well. In each exploration well, the guiding well shall
be logged.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In every case and regardless of the final well depth, DLS shall deliver the well in such
conditions so as that it can be logged.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 10<BR>
DRILLING RECORDS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall enter in the DIMS all the drilling process and drilling mud variables defined as critical
by the Information systems Group at least every two hours (metric cost spreadsheet) or when changes
to parameters are introduced. In addition DLS shall provide a report on the mud properties and use
of materials, using spreadsheets approved by DLS, indicating the depth drilled, formations
encountered and penetrated, data on the drill bit, string of drillpipe, depth at which control
samples were taken and recovered, accidents, equipment tests and all other pertinent information.
Special spreadsheets to be filled in are attached to the appendix. The spreadsheets, forms and
reports created at the completion of the well shall be delivered together with the isolation
cementing reports and forms (PG-AE-AD-01).
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 11<BR>
CONDITION OF THE EQUIPMENT &#150;<BR>
REPAIRS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Condition of the Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling equipment availability, reliability and servicing indexes shall be kept;
interruptions to the service due technical failures or programmed maintenance works shall
also be recorded. (PG-AE-MA-01 &#147;Equipment failure analysis&#148;).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Repairs.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During operation DLS shall perform its equipment maintenance in order for them to carry out
their functions without wasting time. DLS shall perform all repairs immediately and at its
own expense and risk.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Suspension of the Works.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case deficiencies in the equipment that cause unnecessary delays or involve risks to the
personnel are identified, PAE may suspend the works until such deficiencies are eliminated.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 12<BR>
SITE &#150; TRANSIT PERMIT.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE shall produce the access, exit and permanence permits to, from and in the area of location of
the well for the performance of all the works included in these bidding terms. In case of
impossibility to obtain such permits or in case such permits are subject to restrictions or
limitations, PAE shall give DLS immediate written notice. Time lost by DLS as a result shall be
compensated at the Waiting Day tariff.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 13<BR>
MISCELLANEOUS LIABILITIES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Responsibility for Damages or Losses to the Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">13.1.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS surface equipment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible at all time for damages or losses to its surface
equipment, tools, machinery and utensils, whatever the time or way in which the
damage is caused and PAE shall in no way be responsible for reimbursing DLS.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">13.1.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS equipment in the Well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible for damages to or destruction of its equipment in the
well, except in case they are attributable to a borehole obstruction for
differential pressure or force majeure.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Damage to the Well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case of fire or blow out or if the well is lost or damaged for causes attributable to
DLS, its subcontractors or employees, the consequences of such loss or damage shall be
borne by DLS; in case that, as a result thereof, the well cannot be drilled up to the
programmed depth, at PAE&#146;s, DLS shall immediately at its own expense commence the drilling
of a new well up to the same depth reached by the damaged or lost well. If the well is lost
or damaged without negligence by DLS, however, but as a result of PAE&#146;s pipe or equipment
failure, whether during or after the installation of the pipes, or as a consequence of
failures occurred during the cementing operation that result in pipe breakage, such loss
shall be borne by PAE and DLS shall be compensated for:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All the works performed by DLS prior to such loss at the OHR tariff;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All the works performed in an attempt to restore the well to normal
conditions, at the OHR.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">13.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Materials Provided by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS agrees to carefully inspect at the site all the materials and equipment for the well
provided by PAE and to notify PAE in writing about any apparent defects found, in the way
and within the timeframe necessary for PAE to be able to replace such defective materials
or equipment. Failure by DLS to give notice the materials and equipment shall be deemed
free of apparent defects.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible for the preservation of the materials, equipment, tools and all
other items provided by PAE, and shall keep them in good condition in order to return them
or respond for them as the case may be. While in DLS&#146;s possession, such elements shall be
deemed under DLS&#146;s custody.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 14<BR>
RELATIONSHIPS AMONG THE PARTIES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The creation of an alliance between PAE and DLS may lead to the development of new
relationships based on mutual trust, the sharing of operation information and, above all, it
may raise both companies awareness on the need to insure their personnel and goods, to
preserve the environment and to constantly improve themselves for the benefit of the
companies and personnel involved.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies shall share all the operation information related to the activities of the
Alliance. This information may be transmitted or accessed through common databases to which
access shall be granted via authorizations or passwords.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each company organizing a technical training activity involving the interests of the
Alliance shall invite representatives of the other company to attend.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purposes of training of personnel and prior agreement and scheduling, any company
may assign its own personnel specific tasks to be performed at the other company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies undertake to systematically analyze the performance of the Alliance in
order to benefit from its achievements and prevent possible errors.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">14.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In order to ensure the consolidation of the management model proposed for the Alliance
and the goals described above, the parties agree, whenever deemed necessary and by mutual
agreement, to adjust the organization of the activities to be performed so that it better
suits the Alliance needs.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>An Alliance Leader, reporting simultaneously to PAE&#146;s GSJ Development Management and to the
DLS Base Management, shall be appointed by mutual agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The following staff shall also be appointed: a Leader and Co-Leader for each Drilling Team,
employed by DLS; a Drilling Engineering team composed of 1 Engineering Leader and 2
Engineers, all of whom shall be proposed by PAE; 2 Engineers proposed by DLS and a
supervisor from SSA. All these officers shall report to the Alliance Leader.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 15<BR>
AMENDMENTS TO THE SCHEDULE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall perform the works and operations in accordance with the schedule provided by PAE and
with the programs prepared by the Alliance Engineering Department. Such programs may be amended
in reasonable ways and timeframes and, in such case, such amendments shall be approved by the
Alliance Leader.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 16<BR>
RECORDING SYSTEM OF THE<BR>
ALLIANCE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Alliance records system shall be composed of the DLS Quality Management System, the PAE
Environmental Management System, the PAE Safety Management System and the procedures and
guidelines prepared under the scope of the Alliance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This system takes into consideration the preparation of special documentation for this Agreement
in particular. The operation procedures that require to be reviewed and that fall within the
scope of the PAE/DLS Alliance shall be jointly considered by both Companies. The preparation of
the same shall be subject to the &#147;Preparation of the Procedures Created under the Scope of the
PAE-DLS Alliance&#148; procedure (PG-AE-GC-01).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In case of conflict between the latter and PAE&#146;s and DLS&#146;s own procedures, the Alliance
procedures shall prevail.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The procedures and guidelines describe the records created and provide objective guarantee and
evidence that the required quality and safety standards were met and that the quality system has
been properly put in practice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 17<BR>
CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any data or information deriving from or related to the drilling operations and other oil activity
in the area, of whatever kind or nature, shall be treated by the parties as strictly confidential.
The contents of such information shall under no circumstances be revealed to third parties, either
in whole or in part. The same obligation applies to the parties employees, subcontractors and their
employees and any other individual or entity related to the parties.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">E. Rotary table performance<BR>
Continuous Spinning rate

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. Rotary table : Brand : Ideco Model : RT 20.5 API opening 20 1/2&#148;<BR>
2. Independently commanded table, max.<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>RPM<BR>
3. Independent command unit, Brand<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> Model:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><BR>
4. Command unit, engine, Brand, Model:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> HP Continuous capacity.<BR>
5. Table commanded through the switchboard<BR>
Change I 0 RPM to 120 RPM Change III &#95;&#95;&#95; RPM to  &#95;&#95;&#95; RPM<BR>
Change II 0 RPM to 220 RPM Change IV  &#95;&#95;&#95; RPM to<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM

</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

    <TD nowrap colspan="3" align="center" valign="top">N&#176; of Lines
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">FORM. API N&#176; D10-E<BR>
PROGRAM D<BR>
MUD PUMPS PERFORMANCE CAPACITY

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">EQUIPMENT IDENTIFICATION: DLS-101


</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="64%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR style="font-size: 8pt" valign="bottom">
<TD>Specifications Pumps</TD>

    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 0px solid #000000">(1) Principal</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 0px solid #000000">(2) Auxiliary</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="left" style="border-bottom: 0px solid #000000">(3) Auxiliary</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">Brand (manufacturer)

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">E. Rotary table performance<BR>
Continuous Spinning rate

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 3%; margin-top: 6pt">1. Rotary table : Brand : G. Denver Model :RT 22.5 API opening: 22 1/2&#148;<BR>
2. Independently commanded table, max.<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>RPM<BR>
3. Independently command unit, Brand<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> Model:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><BR>
4. Command unit, engine, Brand, Model:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> HP Continuous capacity.<BR>
5. Table commanded through the switchboard<BR>
Change I 0 RPM to 120 RPM Change III ____RPM to ____ RPM<BR>
Change II 0 RPM to 220 RPM Change IV _____RPM to ____ RPM
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">N&#176; D10-C API FORM.<BR>
A Program<BR>
Casing or drillpipe manoeuvring capacity

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Equipment indetification: DLS-102<BR>
The equipment hook load capacity, for the string of drill pipe is _280M_pounds, limited by Hook<BR>
capacity &#95;&#95;&#95; below<BR>
(weakest link)

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The equipment hook load capacity when moving casing is 280M pounds, limited by hook capacity
&#95;&#95;&#95; below
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="90%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="7%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px">1. Mast or Tower
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">Capacity</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Auxiliary brake observed performance

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">CAPACITY OF THE DIFFERENT COMPONENTS OF THE EQUIPMENT
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">FORM API N&#176; D10-B<BR>
EQUIPMENT CAPACITY &#150; CHEEK LIST

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Equipment Owner: DLS Argentina Limited<BR>
Equipment Identification: DLS-104<BR>
Area of use of the equipment: PAE-Cerro dragon<BR>
Data provided by: DLS &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Date: 06-30-03

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A.
Manoeuvring capacity casing or drill pipe 280 Mb<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-c form, A program)

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">B. Bearing capacity<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-C, B Program)

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">7.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pipes maximum capacity on the setback 250 M lb</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">8.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Rotary table maximum bearing capacity regardless of the load on setback 300 M lb</TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">9.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Side load capacity (only for towers) <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> lb</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">C. Lifting and breaking capacity<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-D, C Program)

</DIV>
<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="23%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="26%">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Brand KOOMEY Model Type 80 N&#176; outputs 8 N&#176; of stations 4

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Accumulator Volume (liquid and gas) 130 gal.

</DIV>

liquid) 3,000 psi.

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">CAPACITY OF THE DIFFERENT COMPONENTS OF THE EQUIPMENT
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">FORM API N&#176; D10-B<BR>
EQUIPMENT CAPACITY &#151; CHECK LIST
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Equipment Owner: DLS Argentina Limited<BR>
Equipment Identification: DLS-136<BR>
Area of use of the equipment: PAE-Cerro dragon<BR>
Data provided by: DLS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Date: 06-30-03

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A. Manoeuvring capacity casing or drill pipe 216 Mb<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-c form, A program)<BR>
B. Bearing capacity<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-C, B Program)

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 3%; margin-top: 6pt">13. Pipes maximum capacity on the setback 203 M lb<BR>
14. Rotary table maximum bearing capacity regardless of the load on setback 305 M lb<BR>
15. Side load capacity (only for towers) <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> lb
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">C. Lifting and breaking capacity<BR>
(From N&#176; D10-D, C Program)

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">HP HOOK &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;HOOK LOAD&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;HOOK VELOCITY<BR>

    <TD align="left" valign="top"><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top"><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U></TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">E. Rotary table performance<BR>
Continuous Spinning rate
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. Rotary table : Brand : Ideco Model :RT 20.5 API opening: 17 1/2&#148;<BR>
2. Independently commanded table, max.
<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM<BR>
3. Independent command unit, Brand <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> Model:<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U><BR>
4. Command unit, engine, Brand, Model: <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> HP Continuous capacity.<BR>
5. Table commanded through the switchboard

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 3%; margin-top: 6pt">Change
I 0 RPM to 130 RPM Change III<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM to <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM<BR>
Change II 0 RPM to 250 RPM Change
IV<U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM to <U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U> RPM

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

    <TD align="right" valign="top">2</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD valign="top"><DIV style="margin-left:0px; text-indent:-0px"><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>
</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap colspan="3" align="center" valign="top"><U>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</U>
</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD nowrap align="right" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">3</TD>
    <TD nowrap valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Other Information on drill pipe conditions such as hard, material, protectors, etc.

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Smooth hardbanding
</DIV>

    <TD nowrap colspan="2" align="right" style="border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Body -->
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">Exhibit&nbsp;1:<BR>
B.O.P. Assemblage
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX II: TECHNICAL APPENDIX</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>II.B &#150; WELL COMPLETION AND WORKOVER AT THE GULF OF SAN JORGE </U><BR>
<U>MANAGEMENT UNIT</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>TABLE OF CONTENTS</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">
<TABLE style="font-size: 10pt" cellspacing="0" border="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<!-- Begin Table Head -->
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD width="88%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<!-- End Table Head -->
<!-- Begin Table Body -->

    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">SECTION 1: LOCATION OF THE WELLS.</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="center">Page 3</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom"><!-- Blank Space -->
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">SECTION 2: PERFORMANCE OF THE WORKS.</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="center">Page 3</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom"><!-- Blank Space -->
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">SECTION 3: TARIFFS.</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" align="center">Page 3</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom"><!-- Blank Space -->
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">&nbsp;</DIV></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>
<TR valign="bottom">
    <TD><DIV style="margin-left:15px; text-indent:-15px">SECTION 4: COMPLETION AND WORKOVER METHODS AND PRACTICES.</DIV></TD>
