<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX II: TECHNICAL APPENDIX</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>II.B &#150; WELLS COMPLETION AND WORKOVER AT THE GULF OF SAN JORGE </U><BR>
<U>MANAGEMENT UNIT</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 1<BR>
LOCATION OF THE WELLS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The sites designed and provided by PAE shall be located within the area of the Gulf of San Jorge
Management Unit, which comprise the areas of Cerro Drag&#243;n, Anticlinal Grande and Anticlinal Funes
corresponding to the North flange and Piedra Clavada and Koluel Kaike corresponding to the South
flange.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 2<BR>
PERFORMANCE OF THE WORKS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall begin and carry on the operations with due diligence and without improper delays or
interruptions and shall perform such operations on the basis of a seven (7)-days-week and twenty
four (24)-hours-working days.<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If an unplanned interruption of the operations extends for a period exceeding 30&nbsp;days, DLS shall
provide a replacement; planned interruptions shall be communicated by DLS two months in advance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In order to ensure the fulfillment of the technical requirements established in the present
Appendix and maintain control over the processes affecting the standards of Quality and Safety set
with respect to the contractual obligations, for the purposes of the Alliance, the Quality Plan
(PG-AE-GC-02) is hereby implemented. This Quality Plan describes the way in which the requirements
of the Agreement are fulfilled and contains the description of how operations are carried out, also
referring to the applicable procedures and instructions to that effect.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 3<BR>
TARIFFS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>General provisions</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall pay DLS for the services rendered on the basis of the tariffs defined herein below:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Waiting Hourly Rate (Stand By). (According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>When the continuance of the completion and workover works is delayed at PAE&#146;s instruction
due to the fact that PAE is waiting for instructions, materials, locations, roads, day
light to carry out transports and other circumstances that do not constitute an event of
force majeure or Act of God.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE may decide to put one or more pieces of equipment &#147;on hold&#148; and during such period DLS
shall be paid the Waiting Hourly Rate. There are no time limitations with respect to &#147;on
hold&#148; situations and the equipment may remain assembled on the well, on the Oilfield or at
DLS&#146;s yard while such situations remain.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Operation Hourly Rate. According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This hourly rate shall apply per each working hour, or a fraction thereof, of the equipment
working during the performance of workover or completion services in the well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Climate Factor Rate. According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This hourly rate shall apply when the working of the equipment is interrupted due to
climatic reasons that prevent the ordinary performance of the operation.</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Transport of Equipment Rate (along the same flange). According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate comprises charges for transport and assemblage and dismantling of Completion
equipment and its accessories between two locations within the same flange at a distance
not exceeding 20Km.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Charge rate for distance in kilometers. According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate shall apply for any distance in kilometers in excess of 20Km.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.7</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Transport of Equipment Rate (between the North and the South flanges). According to Appendix
I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate comprises charges for transport and assemblage and dismantling of Completion
equipment and its accessories between two locations within different flanges.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 4<BR>
COMPLETION AND WORKOVER METHODS AND PRACTICES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Due diligence.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall commence the works on the date indicated by PAE and shall continue to perform
them with due diligence and care, in accordance with good oilfields practices, keeping the
equipment in optimum working conditions and using competent personnel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall employ all necessary care and diligence (in particular but not limited to, the
closure of valves), in order to avoid contamination of the phreatic layers, the
deterioration of the land, field, livestock, premises and, in general, in order to avoid
damages to PAE and to third parties. The protection of the environment shall be governed by
the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, certified by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Required quality</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>With the exceptions necessary for the Gulf of San Jorge, the BP well
operations policy shall apply.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE&#146;s operation procedures and/or guidelines shall be used.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the cases where there are no regulations in force, the minimum standards required are
the ones established by the API recommendations.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Simulation schedules regarding fire, wildwell, environment and first aids shall be duly
fulfilled and the results thereof shall be recorded and analyzed.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>It is hereby agreed that the tools provided by DLS (test bridge plug and packer) shall be
able to be set and work properly at least in three (3)&nbsp;occasions. In case the tools can be
successfully set in less than 3 occasions, DLS shall be responsible of replacing such tools
and for the time spent as a result, which shall be recorded in the field report as no
charge (N/C).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Controlled tests</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purpose of facilitating ongoing improvements to the completion and workover
processes defined in the Agreement, changes in the methodology, introduction of
technologies, change of practices, new mud formulas, etc. shall be carried out through
Controlled Tests (according to the PG-AE-PF-01 procedure) and the results shall determine
the adoption or rejection of the proposed changes.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire and blow outs prevention</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall use all possible means to control and avoid fires and blow outs and
to protect the well. No fire shall be allowed within a 50 meter perimeter around the
well. In case it was necessary to perform welding works on the equipment or in the
surrounding area,</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>an &#147;authorization to perform hot working&#148; from the representative in the Area (Team
Leader).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The B.O.P. shall be placed at the well head in the 5 1/2 &#148; or 7&#148; pipe during
all completion and workover operations and shall be kept in optimum working
conditions. In this respect, DLS shall examine and test the working conditions of the
B.O.P. valves and other equipment as provided for by the &#147;BOP and Manifold Test &#150;
Environmental Management System IO 22.05&#148; guidelines.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall perform well control simulations through well known procedures;
simulations shall involve all working shifts and shall be carried out once for
every well; the results shall be entered in the completion and workover records.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 5<BR>
INFORMATION RECORDING ON COMPLETION AND WORKOVER OPERATIONS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall keep a &#147;daily record of completion and workover operations&#148; where all operations
performed shall be entered. When perforated formations or layers are tested the following
information and tasks shall be particularly carefully recorded on PCs and printers compatible with
the DIMS:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In swabbing tests</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Depths of the tested interval</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Number of swabbing strokes per hour</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fluids levels</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Hourly production</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In surge tests</TD>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>When samples are collected:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In completions of wells or in those repairs where completion is expressly required, the
produced fluid samples shall be preserved in brand new 10 liters polyethylene drums with double
cups for better sealing, on which the following information shall be stated: identification of
the well, hour and date on which the sample was produced, perforated intervals to which the
sample corresponds. This information shall be written on container&#146;s surface with indelible
markers or equivalent method to avoid damage or loss of the identification. Samples shall be
taken following the methodology (see Instructions IO 22.03) and the instructions expressly
given by PAE&#146;s Completion and Workover Department. (Drums and means of identification provided
by PAE).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All data that may contribute to a better knowledge of the tested zones shall be recorded.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 6<BR>
MATERIALS, EQUIPMENT, SERVICES, PERSONNEL, ETC. PROVIDED BY DLS DURING THE<BR>
COMPLETION AND WORKOVER OPERATIONS.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall provide the principal and auxiliary equipment necessary to comply with the working
schedule.
Likewise, PAE&#146;s &#147;Wells Operation and Drilling Policies&#148; shall be observed where applicable.</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE reserves the right to expressly accept an amount of equipment not strictly suitable to fulfill this condition according to its completion and workover program.</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, PAE requires at least the following:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Application of the &#147;Technical and Basic Safety Rules for Drilling, Workover and Pulling
Operations&#148; (PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure) for the PAE-DLS Strategic Alliance.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Check list to verify the fulfillment of the PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure. (To be adapted in case
it is necessary)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>

</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To operate with 2 7/8&#148;, 2 3/8&#148; or 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; tubing up to 3,500 meters</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

between sites and removal of equipment at the termination of the Agreement.</TD>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.12</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Personnel and Camp</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD colspan="2">Personnel shall comply with sections 4.1, 10.2 and 14 of this Appendix and furthermore:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Working days shall be divided into 8 (eight)&nbsp;or 12 (twelve)&nbsp;hour shifts. 12 x
12 regimes are not allowed (12 hours rest x 12 hours work).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Camps to host personnel within the area of the Agreement are not allowed.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.13</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Communications</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall maintain permanent radio contact between the completion and
workover teams and PAE&#146;s camp at Cerro Drag&#243;n. PAE shall provide voice and data
communication among the Completion and Workover teams.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall comply with the following procedures for data use and entry on DIMS
once such system is implemented:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;DIMS operation procedure&#148; (for completion) &#147;Data quality control and
handling of information&#148; (for completion)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Mandatory reports to be entered on DIMS&#148; (for completion)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Intercom for risk areas between the engine driver and the derrickman at the
racking platform and two (2)&nbsp;Walkie Talkie units for risk areas available for the
Team. The equipment are owned by PAE and shall be maintained by DLS.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Three dry chemical powder ABC type, potassium base, fire trucks of 100 Kg.
capacity or three dry chemical powder fire trucks of 70 Kg. capacity.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Six dry chemical powder ABC type, potassium base, manual extinguishers of 10
Kg. capacity or six dry chemical powder manual extinguishers of 7 Kg. capacity.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All the equipment described in a. and b. above shall be nitrogen pressurized
and have a pressure control gauge.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">d.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Two carbon dioxide extinguishers of 5 Kg. capacity each.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">e.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The equipment shall be placed at strategic places. The trucks shall not be
over 20 meters away from the drilling equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">f.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition, all other equipment required by legal regulations in force.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">g.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The team shall hold safety meetings once a week (each shift) during shifts
change.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Drilling equipment availability, reliability and servicing indexes shall be kept;
interruptions to the service due technical failures or programmed maintenance works shall
also be recorded. (PG-AE-MA-01 &#147;Equipment failure analysis&#148;).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Repairs.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During operation DLS shall perform its equipment maintenance in order for them to carry out
their functions without wasting time. DLS shall perform all repairs immediately and at its
own expense and risk.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Suspension of the Works.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case deficiencies in the equipment that cause unnecessary delays in the works are
identified, the company may suspend the works and such suspension shall create no
obligations. Deficiencies involving risks to the personnel shall also cause suspension at
no cost.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 9<BR>
SITE &#150; TRANSIT PERMIT.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE shall produce the access, exit and permanence permits to, from and in the area of location of
the well for the performance of all the works included in these bidding terms. In case of
impossibility to obtain such permits or in case such permits are subject to restrictions or
limitations, PAE shall give DLS immediate written notice. Time lost by DLS as a result shall be
compensated at the Waiting Hour tariff.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 10<BR>
MISCELLANEOUS LIABILITIES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">10.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Responsibility for Damages or Losses to the Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">10.1.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS surface equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible at all time for damages or losses to its surface
equipment, tools, machinery and utensils, whatever the time or way in which the
damage is caused and PAE shall in no way be responsible for reimbursing DLS.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">10.1.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS equipment in the Well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall be responsible for damages to or destruction of DLS equipment in the
well, except in case they are not attributable to negligence or equipment failure
by DLS.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">10.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Materials Provided by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS agrees to carefully inspect all the materials and equipment provided by PAE and to
notify PAE in writing about any apparent defects found, in the way and within the timeframe
necessary for PAE to be able to replace such defective materials or equipment. Failure by
DLS to give notice the materials and equipment shall be deemed free of apparent defects.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible for the materials, equipment and all other items provided by PAE,
and shall keep them in good condition in order to return them or respond for them as the
case may be. While in DLS&#146;s possession, such elements shall be deemed under DLS&#146;s custody.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 11<BR>
RELATIONSHIPS WITH DLS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The creation of an alliance between PAE and DLS may lead to the development of new
relationships based on mutual trust, the sharing of operation information and, above all, it
may raise both companies awareness on the need to insure their personnel and goods, to
preserve the</TD>
</TR>


</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>environment and to constantly improve themselves for the benefit of the companies and
personnel involved.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies shall share all the operation information related to the activities of
the Alliance. This information may be transmitted or accessed through common databases to
which access shall be granted via authorizations or passwords.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each company organizing a technical training activity involving the interests of the
Alliance shall invite representatives of the other company to attend.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purposes of training of personnel and prior agreement and scheduling, any company
may assign its own personnel specific tasks to be performed at the other company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies undertake to systematically analyze the performance of the Alliance in
order to benefit from its achievements and prevent possible errors.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 12<BR>
AMENDMENTS TO THE SCHEDULE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall perform the works and operations in accordance with the schedule provided by PAE and with
the programs prepared by the Completion and Workover Engineering Department. Such programs may be
amended in reasonable ways and timeframes and, in such case, such amendments shall be approved by
PAE&#146;s completion and workover supervisor.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 13<BR>
RECORDING SYSTEM OF THE ALLIANCE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Alliance records system shall be composed of the DLS Quality Management System, the PAE
Environmental Management System, the PAE Safety Management System and the procedures and
guidelines prepared under the scope of the Alliance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This system takes into consideration the preparation of special documentation for this Agreement
in particular. The operation procedures that require to be reviewed and that fall within the
scope of the PAE/DLS Alliance shall be jointly considered by both Companies. The preparation of
the same shall be subject to the &#147;Preparation of the Procedures Created under the Scope of the
PAE-DLS Alliance&#148; procedure (PG-AE-GC-01).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In case of conflict between the latter and PAE&#146;s and DLS&#146;s own procedures, the Alliance
procedures shall prevail.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The procedures and guidelines describe the records created and provide objective guarantee and
evidence that the required quality and safety standards were met and that the quality system has
been properly put in practice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 14: CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any data or information deriving from or related to the drilling operations and other oil activity
in the area, of whatever kind or nature, shall be treated by the parties as strictly confidential.
The contents of such information shall under no circumstances be revealed to third parties, either
in whole or in part. The same obligation applies to the parties employees, subcontractors and their
employees and any other individual or entity related to the parties.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>APPENDIX II: TECHNICAL APPENDIX</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>II.C &#150; WELL PULLING RIG SERVICE AT THE GULF OF SAN JORGE </U><BR>
<U>MANAGEMENT UNIT</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 1<BR>
LOCATION OF THE WELLS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The sites designed and provided by PAE shall be located within the area of the Gulf of San Jorge
Management Unit, which comprise the areas of Cerro Drag&#243;n, Anticlinal Grande and Anticlinal Funes
corresponding to the North flange and Piedra Clavada and Koluel Kaike corresponding to the South
flange.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 2<BR>
PERFORMANCE OF THE WORKS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall begin and carry on the operations with due diligence and without improper delays or
interruptions and shall perform such operations on the basis of a seven (7)-days-week and twenty
four (24)-hours-working days.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">
If an unplanned interruption of the operations extends for a period exceeding 30&nbsp;days, DLS shall
provide a replacement; planned interruptions shall be communicated by DLS two months in advance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In order to ensure the fulfillment of the technical requirements established in the present
Appendix and maintain control over the processes affecting the standards of Quality and Safety set
with respect to the contractual obligations, for the purposes of the Alliance, the Quality Plan
(PG-AE-GC-02) is hereby implemented. This Quality Plan describes the way in which the requirements
of the Agreement are fulfilled and contains the description of how operations are carried out, also
_deferring to the applicable procedures and instructions to that effect.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 3<BR>
TARIFFS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>General provisions</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall pay DLS for the services rendered by using light or heavy pulling equipment on
the basis of the tariffs defined herein below:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Waiting Hourly Rate.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate shall be applied to all operations performed at the well when the pulling unit is
idle , which may occur in situations such as: waiting for day light to perform transport
activities, waiting for the site with all personnel ready at the site, waiting for a work
order, change of site during DTM, waiting or operating service companies,<BR><BR>

According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#151; Prices</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Operation Hourly Rate.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This hourly rate shall be applied to all operations performed with the equipment and all of
the personnel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Climate Factor Rate.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This hourly rate shall be applied in case of strong winds, snow or heavy rain.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Transport of Equipment Rate (along the same flange). According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate comprises charges for transport and assemblage and dismantling of the pulling
unit and its accessories between two locations within the same flange at a distance not
exceeding 20Km.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.6</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Charge rate for distance in kilometers. According to Appendix&nbsp;I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate shall apply for any distance in kilometers in excess of 20Km.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">3.7</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Transport of Equipment Rate (between the North and the South flanges). According to Appendix
I &#150; Prices.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>This rate comprises charges for transport and assemblage and dismantling of the pulling
unit and its accessories between two locations within different flanges.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 4<BR>
PULLING RIG SERVICE METHODS AND PRACTICES.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Due diligence.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall commence the works on the date indicated by PAE and shall continue to perform
them with due diligence and care, in accordance with good oilfields practices, keeping the
equipment in optimum working conditions and using competent personnel.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall employ all necessary care and diligence (in particular but not limited to, the
closure of valves), in order to avoid contamination of the phreatic layers, the
deterioration of the land, field, livestock, premises and, in general, in order to avoid
damages to PAE and to third parties. The protection of the environment shall be governed by
the ISO 14001 Environmental Management System, certified by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Required quality</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During the performance of the works DLS shall comply with the provisions of PAE&#146;s &#147;Pulling
intervention Program&#148; as set forth by the PG-AE-TP-01 procedure.<BR>
For all operations involving the handling of rods the &#147;Handling of rods&#148; guidelines
(IT-AE-TP-04) shall apply.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Operations</U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Prior to transporting to a well Pan American supervisor shall deliver to DLS the
intervention program.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall inspect the roads, site and anchor of the well to be intervened in order to
verify the normal development of the transport.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The contractor shall issue the operation reports in three copies and shall provide detail
on each maneuver taking longer than 15 minutes; this information shall be updated and
available for the team at all times. At midnight the information shall be delivered to the
Pulling Coordination office at Cerro Drag&#243;n.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pan American shall have 2 (two)&nbsp;working days to amend such reports and return them to DLS
duly approved stating the charges corresponding to the contractor.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible for checking all the materials located at the site against the
work order and for immediately giving Pan American Energy supervisor notice of any
irregularity or missing materials, if any.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">4.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire and blow outs prevention</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;a.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall use all possible means to control and avoid fires and blow outs and
to protect the well. No fire shall be allowed within a 50 meter perimeter around the
well. In case it was necessary to perform welding works on the equipment or in the
surrounding area, an &#147;authorization to perform hot working&#148; from the representative in
the Area (Team Leader).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;&nbsp;b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Prior to commencing operations involving tubing movements, the B.O.P. shall
be properly installed with bolts at the well head and it shall be kept in optimum
working conditions. In this respect, DLS shall examine and test the working conditions
of the</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>B.O.P. valves and other equipment following each assemblage and it shall record the
results of such tests in the register book. DLS shall perform well control
simulations through well known procedures and the results shall be entered in the
Pulling reports.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">c.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>B.O.P. Tests</U></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>&#150;</B> The equipment B.O.P. shall be tested at least once a month with 2,000 psi. There
shall be a record where the date, well, testing pressure, name of the attending
supervisor as well as any detected anomaly shall be recorded. There shall be 2
3/8&#148;, 2 7/8&#148; and 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; RAMS.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">4.5 Liabilities
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The ISO 14001 Environmental Management System certified by PAE shall be applicable. DLS shall clean
oil and other fluids spills and repair the damages caused at the site during operations in a well,
provided however such damages are attributable to DLS. The contractor shall employ special care
with respect to countryside gates and shall also avoid water contamination and damage to the land,
fences, livestock or any other property, owned either by third parties or by Pan American and
shall, at its own cost and expense, repair all damages caused by reasons attributable to its
personnel or subcontractors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The inspection, supervision or presence of one or more supervisors of Pan American shall not exempt
the contractor from its responsibilities and obligations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The contractor shall cause Pan American operation and safety rules to be fulfilled by any person
accessing the site where the pulling equipment is in operation. In addition, the team&#146;s personnel
shall have all the safety items in optimum conditions.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 5<BR>
INFORMATION RECORDING ON COMPLETION AND WORKOVER OPERATIONS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall keep a &#147;daily record of pulling operations&#148; according to the (PG-09-DO-02) procedure,
where all operations performed shall be entered, (PE-09-DO-02/03A2) register. This register shall
be deliver to PAE Pulling Coordinator on a daily basis.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All the information shall be entered in a PC in order for it to be available in digital version
(Diskette) or CD.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 6<BR>
MATERIALS, EQUIPMENT, SERVICES, PERSONNEL, ETC. PROVIDED BY DLS DURING THE PULLING RIG OPERATIONS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS shall provide the principal and auxiliary equipment necessary to comply with the working
schedule.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Likewise, PAE&#146;s &#147;Wells Operation and Drilling Policies&#148; shall be observed where applicable.
</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE reserves the right to expressly accept an amount of equipment not strictly suitable to fulfill
this condition according to its pulling program.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, PAE requires at least the following:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Application of the &#147;Technical and Basic Safety Rules for Drilling, Workover and Pulling
Operations&#148; (PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure) for the PAE-DLS Strategic Alliance.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Check list to verify the fulfillment of the PG-AE-SE-03 Procedure. (To be adapted in case
it is necessary)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Dismantling, Transport and Assemblage of Tower Equipment Safety (PG-AE-SE-01 Procedure).
(To be adapted in case it is necessary)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Trucks and hoisting elements Certification and Audit Procedure (IT-AE-TR-05). (To be
adapted in case it is necessary).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">6.1 <U><B>Equipment description </B></U>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U><B>Drawworks</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Double Drum: 200 / 300 HP

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capacities
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Hoisting capacity: 75 TN<BR>
Maximum Working weight: 90,000 Lbs.<BR>
Wind resistance against chute at the tower: 100 Km/hour<BR>
Swabbing Drum: 3,500 Mts.

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Mast
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Type: Structural<BR>
Height: 96&#146; &#150; 98<BR>
Capacity: 140,000 &#150; 180,000 Lbs.<BR>
Safety Device: Safety mechanism for Hoisting Gear course

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hoisting Gear
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Capacity: 75 TN<BR>
Pulleys: 3 x 20&#148;.

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rod Elevator
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">To be used for rods of: &#147;&#150; <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>3</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT>&#148; &#150; 7/8&#148; &#150; 1&#148;<BR>
Work capacity 25 TN.<BR>
Maximum capacity 40 TN.

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Rod Wrench
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Type B.J. &#150; Mark V<BR>
For rods of: &#150; <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>3</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">4</FONT> &#147; &#150; 7/8&#148; &#150; 1&#148;

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tubing
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Type: Foster<BR>
For tubing of: 2 3/8&#148; &#150; 2 7/8&#148; &#150; 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT> &#148;

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U><B>Surge Prevention</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">B.O.P.<BR>
Type: Double<BR>
Closures: In whole and in part 2 3/8&#148; &#150; 2 7/8&#148; &#150; 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT> &#148;<BR>
Interior passage: 7 1/16&#148;<BR>
Maximum work pressure: 3,000 psi.<BR>
Maximum proof pressure: 5,000 psi.

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">B.O.P. for rods

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Hook for hanging pulleys to operate electric-submersible pumps (E.S.P.)</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 6%; margin-top: 6pt">Power station 20 KW
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 6%; margin-top: 6pt">Lighting
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Type Explosion proof<BR>
Minimum luminosity 84 lux

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Capstan
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Type: Hydraulic<BR>
Maximum capacity 1,500 Kg<BR>
Cable <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT> &#147;<BR>
Untwister Bearing

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 6%; margin-top: 6pt">-
Capstan (do not use catline)<BR>
- - All gear must be equipped to work with 3,000 psi.
</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><U>Heavy pulling equipment shall have rotary head, pit and injection pump</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mud system

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Triplex pump apt for operating under the following operation conditions:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Other Work Conditions and Requirements</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">6.3.1 B.O.P. installation, service pressure API 3,000 psi: &#151; Two valves or one double valve
with two sets of rams, one of blind rams and one for the tubing in use. &#151; B.O.P. adapter
flange
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">6.3.2 Test tree for 3,000 psi working pressure with maneuvering valve, manifold and lines for
3,000 psi working pressure.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">All equipment shall be inspected by Pan American Energy supervision before being entered into
the area and authorization for such equipment to start operating shall be previously granted.
Only equipment authorized by Pan American Energy may operate; in case of equipment
replacement a new inspection shall be required.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">A file containing all equipment technical data, including tools, overshots and their
corresponding entry dates, date of last repair, inspection date, maintenance and replacement
date shall be kept; this data shall be magnetically certified.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The rig shall keep another file for the purpose of controlling the amount of tons-miles for
which the hoisting gear cable is used keeping record of the measurements and cuts performed
thereon.<BR>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Regarding the swab cable, records shall be kept on the number of meters left in the drum, the
reasons for the cuts thereon, the number of meters cut and the number of meters left.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The trailer for the rig shall be of the office type and shall be mounted on a 2 shaft chasis,
shall have an office space for the supervisor and a dinning space for the personnel, with a
table and an electric stove, plus an electric heating system suited to the winter climate in
the operation area.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Drinking water supply.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Vehicles entering the site shall be parked outside the boundaries set the safety chain, which
shall go beyond the line between the anchors.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The contractor&#146;s equipment shall have 4 or 5 supports on the sides to carry four 1&#148; rods for
the replacements during fishing and hooking operations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">

</DIV>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Valve and reductions of 2&#148; for 3,000 psi working pressure to close the borehole
in use, 2 3/8&#148;, 2 7/8&#148; and 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148;.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The headwell adaptors to the B.O.P., pipe testers with pressure Equalizing systems (as requested by
Pan American), swab cups and rod stripper rubber seals are included among the elements to be
provided by the contractor. The sealing grease for tubing and lubricant for rods shall be provided
by Pan American.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The contractor shall have regular tools for the purpose of fishing the right hand thread tubing
(API version) type, the 4 9/16&#148; diameter, Series&nbsp;150 Overshot type (Exterior Overshots) with 5 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148;
and 7&#148; guides, in order to fish pin, body, upset and 2 3/8&#148;, 2 7/8&#148; and 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; coupling; in addition
the contractor shall have an interior tubing overshot of the 4 9/16&#148; diameter Center Spear type for
2 3/8&#148;, 2 7/8&#148; and 3 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; interior tubing fishing, with 5 <FONT style="font-size: 70%"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT>/<FONT style="font-size: 60%">2</FONT>&#148; and 7&#148; guides. The contractor shall also
provide printers, substitutes and reductions for all types of overshots.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The equipment shall include all the necessary elements in order to operate with
electric-submersible pumps.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
