    <TD>Transport</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The following transport procedures and guidelines agreed under the scope of
the Alliance shall be applied:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Tower equipment Dismantling, Transport and Assemblage Safety
procedure&#148; (PG-AE-SE-01). (To be adapted in case it is necessary)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;Road machinery support&#148; (IT-AE-TR-03). (To be adapted in case it
is necessary)</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All transport of DLS equipment to the area of the Agreement,
transport between sites and removal of equipment at the termination of the
Agreement.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case roads are in bad conditions, PAE shall assist DLS in
carrying out the transport.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="10%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>All transport of DLS materials and personnel necessary for the
operations.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.11</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Personnel and Camp</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Personnel shall comply with sections 4.1, 10.2 and 13 of this Appendix and furthermore:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Working days shall be divided into 8 (eight)&nbsp;or 12 (twelve)&nbsp;hour shifts. 12 x
12 regimes are not allowed (12 hours rest x 12 hours work).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Camps to host personnel within the area of the Agreement are not allowed.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Personnel</U>:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The team shall have a tourpusher or pulling supervisor, one driller, one derrickman and two
floormenat the wellhead.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition the team shall have a Field Supervisor, who shall be in charge of a minimum of 1 (one)
and a maximum of 5 (five)&nbsp;teams operating at the Pan American area; his duties shall be to
supervise the pulling units and keep the Pan American supervision department informed about all
news and maneuvers performed by the pulling teams. The Field Supervisor shall work at the field
from Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm and be responsible for the pulling unit special works such
as: tubing fishing, non-routine maneuvers at the well, injection wells, perforations, bottom
cleaning with special tools, etc. and shall remain in the rig during the performance of such
operations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The transport of personnel, equipment, tools, accessories, fuel and lubricants shall be carried out
the contractor&#146;s own risk and expense.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.12 Communications<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Each rig shall have a radio-communication equipment, able to establish contact with all of the Pan
American area and maintain such communication permanently and efficiently 24 hours a day. This
system shall be connected to Pan American&#146;s system in order for news and maneuvers performed to be
reported. In addition the Field Supervisor shall have a similar equipment on his vehicle. The
contractor shall place a similar equipment at its base in order to ensure the means of
communication.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.13 Safety, Health and Environment
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">No alcoholic beverages or fire arms shall be allowed and no timber picking shall be allowed at the
area operated by Pan American.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Vehicles, equipment and machinery. Vehicles for transporting personnel and light cargo shall not be
over 5&nbsp;years old models: automobiles, pick up and small trucks similar to an F-350. Heavy cargo
vehicles, buses and trucks shall not be over 10&nbsp;years old models and shall be in perfect use and
safety conditions. All vehicles shall bear the contracting company logo and the vehicle&#146;s internal
number at a visible place (at least on the four sides) and any other plate or identification item
issued by Pan American.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Specific personal protection equipment: Pirosalva, safeguarding, harness for derrickman with double
life line and one retractable line.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pulling equipment transport: pulling equipment may not be transported along national or provincial
roads during night time. Pan American has sufficient secondary roads in order to transport
equipment throughout all the oilfield. The crossing of such roads shall be allowed provided beacons
are placed while crossing the equipment. In case a piece of equipment is being transported and the
night falls, the vehicle shall leave the road, place beacons to identify the equipment and wait
until day light in order to carry on.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6.14 Fire equipment and SH2 inhalation prevention.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">SH2 and explosive mixtures continuous monitoring to work at areas where the presence of SH2 or gas
has been detected.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Self-contained breathing apparatus (30 minutes) to work at areas where SH2 has been detected
(equipment for 5 persons to be used by any of the 6 pulling teams).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Extinguishers: a total of 110 Kg dry powder, apt for Class&nbsp;B and C fires (2 fire trucks 25 kg
capacity and 6 extinguishers 10 kg capacity).
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.15</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Fire prevention and surge control training.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During the pulling operations in a well, different shifts of personnel shall be trained on
fire prevention, as provided for by the simulation plan. Written records of the dates and
training issues shall be kept.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.16</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Electric safety equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Electric equipment shall be explosion proof, shall have a safety-break switch on the
switchboard and in the team&#146;s trailer. Equipment engines shall have flame arresters and/or a
device that prevents engine acceleration when working in a gaseous atmosphere. The minimum
luminosity at the main places (such as wellhead) shall be 84 lux.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="right"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Stakes.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">6.17</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>First Aid Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Medicine cabinet with the items necessary to provide immediate aid.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Stretcher to carry injured persons (foldable).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In addition, all other equipment required by legal regulations in force.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Independent eye-washing station equipped with sterile liquids.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 8<BR>
CONDITION OF THE EQUIPMENT &#150; REPAIRS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Condition of the Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Pulling equipment availability, reliability and servicing indexes shall be kept;
interruptions to the service due technical failures or programmed maintenance works shall
also be recorded. (PG-AE-MA-01 &#147;Equipment failure analysis&#148;).</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Suspension of the Works.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>It should also involve deficiencies involving risks to the personnel shall also cause
suspension at no cost.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Repairs.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During operation DLS shall perform its equipment maintenance in order for them to carry out
their functions without wasting time. DLS shall perform all repairs immediately and at its
own expense and risk.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">8.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Suspension of the Works.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case deficiencies in the equipment that cause unnecessary delays in the works are
identified, the company may suspend the works and such suspension shall create no
obligations.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">8.4 Non-destructive Inspection
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Non-destructive tests shall be performed on the equipment (the penetrating ink or magnaflux type)
assigned to permanent and variable solicitations (masts, hoisting equipment, substructure,
lifting jacks, crown block, structure knots, dead center, etc.).</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">An updated report on such tests shall be available with respect to all equipment entering the Pan
American area. Required inspection schedule is as follows:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Every 6&nbsp;months: M. Decker tension indicator calibration<BR>
Every 2&nbsp;years: Mast and crown block<BR>
Every year: Braking system, wind guy line, hoisting equipment, hooks, tongs, elevators, lifting<BR>
jacks and slips.

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Pan American supervision department shall be presented with the supporting documents evidencing
the performance of such inspection. All documents shall be delivered when replacing a piece of
equipment or in January every year, together with the documents corresponding to the equipment
operating at Pan American area.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 9<BR>
SITE &#150; TRANSIT PERMIT.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE shall produce the access, exit and permanence permits to, from and in the area of location of
the well for the performance of all the works included in these bidding terms. In case of
impossibility to obtain such permits or in case such permits are subject to restrictions or
limitations, PAE shall give DLS immediate written notice. Time lost by DLS as a result shall be
compensated at the Waiting Hour tariff.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 10<BR>
MISCELLANEOUS LIABILITIES.
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">10.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Responsibility for Damages or Losses to the Equipment.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">10.2.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS surface equipment.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible at all time for damages or losses to its surface
equipment, tools, machinery and utensils, whatever the time or way in which the
damage is caused and PAE shall in no way be responsible for reimbursing DLS.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>


    <TD colspan="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.1.2 &nbsp;DLS equipment in the Well.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE shall be responsible for damages to or destruction of DLS equipment in the
well, except in case they are not attributable to negligence or equipment failure
by DLS.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">10.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Materials Provided by PAE.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS agrees to carefully inspect all the materials and equipment provided by PAE and to
notify PAE in writing about any apparent defects found, in the way and within the timeframe
necessary for PAE to be able to replace such defective materials or equipment. Failure by
DLS to give notice the materials and equipment shall be deemed free of apparent defects.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>DLS shall be responsible for the materials, equipment and all other items provided by PAE,
and shall keep them in good condition in order to return them or respond for them as the
case may be. While in DLS&#146;s possession, such elements shall be deemed under DLS&#146;s custody.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 11<BR>
RELATIONSHIPS WITH DLS.
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The creation of an alliance between PAE and DLS may lead to the development of new
relationships based on mutual trust, the sharing of operation information and, above all, it
may raise both companies awareness on the need to insure their personnel and goods, to
preserve the environment and to constantly improve themselves for the benefit of the
companies and personnel involved.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.2</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies shall share all the operation information related to the activities of
the Alliance. This information may be transmitted or accessed through common databases to
which access shall be granted via authorizations or passwords.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.3</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Each company organizing a technical training activity involving the interests of the
Alliance shall invite representatives of the other company to attend.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.4</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>For the purposes of training of personnel and prior agreement and scheduling, any company
may assign its own personnel specific tasks to be performed at the other company.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left">11.5</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Both companies undertake to systematically analyze the performance of the Alliance in
order to benefit from its achievements and prevent possible errors.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 12<BR>
RECORDING SYSTEM OF THE ALLIANCE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Alliance records system shall be composed of the DLS Quality Management System, the PAE
Environmental Management System, the PAE Safety Management System and the procedures and
guidelines prepared under the scope of the Alliance.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This system takes into consideration the preparation of special documentation for this Agreement
in particular. The operation procedures that require to be reviewed and that fall within the
scope of the PAE/DLS Alliance shall be jointly considered by both Companies. The preparation of
the same shall be
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">subject to the &#147;Preparation of the Procedures Created under the Scope of the PAE-DLS Alliance&#148;
procedure (PG-AE-GC-01).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In case of conflict between the latter and PAE&#146;s and DLS&#146;s own procedures, the Alliance
procedures shall prevail.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The procedures and guidelines describe the records created and provide objective guarantee and
evidence that the required quality and safety standards were met and that the quality system has
been properly put in practice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SECTION 14: CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any data or information deriving from or related to the pulling operations and other oil activity
in the area, of whatever kind or nature, shall be treated by the parties as strictly confidential.
The contents of such information shall under no circumstances be revealed to third parties, either
in whole or in part. The same obligation applies to the parties employees, subcontractors and their
employees and any other individual or entity related to the parties.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
