<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Company the works performed and the materials, equipment, etc,
owned by the Company or even those
supplied by Contractor but which have already been paid for by the Company, in accordance with
certificates submitted by Contractor for such purpose, immediately, and the corresponding minutes
shall be drawn and shall be signed by the Company and Contractor.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>19.&nbsp;Other events of termination: </B>The Company shall be entitled to terminate the contract in case of
death (if Contractor is an individual) or in case of insolvency, reorganization, bankruptcy or
liquidation of Contractor &#150; except when such petition is dismissed within a term of sixty (60)&nbsp;days
&#150; or due to the spin-off or merger of Contractor with third parties without the express consent of
the Company, except when, in the sole judgment of the Company, it decides to continue the contract
with the successors of Contractor.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>20.&nbsp;Patents and trademarks: </B>Contractor hereby warrants that no manufacturing, installation or
assembly of the works, or rendering of the service or use or operation of the works that may
perform the Company, shall mean or imply an infringement to any patent of invention, utility model,
trademark or other intellectual or industrial property right. Contractor shall fully hold Company
harmless and, if applicable, shall adequately indemnify it (including expenses and reasonable
attorneys costs), against any damage resulting from any claim, loss, expense or action arising from
the use by Contractor or its Subcontractors of patents of invention, trademarks or intellectual or
industrial property in general, or from any eventual infringement thereto.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>21.&nbsp;Assignment of Accounts Receivable: </B>Contractor shall make its best efforts not to assign,
transfer or constitute a commercial pledge on the accounts receivable resulting from the contract,
for no reason or cause whatsoever.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In case of an assignment of invoices (whether they be ordinary invoices or credit invoices, should
the issue of the latter be mandatory) or pledge thereon that implies that the Company must make
payments to a person different to Contractor, the Company (a)&nbsp;must receive an adequate compensation
for the higher costs this payment may cause; and (b)&nbsp;shall demand as an essential condition for any
assignment of accounts receivable, compliance with provisions of Appendix&nbsp;IV of these General
Bidding Terms.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The occurrence of some of these events or the repetition thereof shall entitle the Company to
terminate the contract.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>22. Confidentiality &#150; Conflict of Interests:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">22.1 Contractor, its personnel and, if applicable, Subcontractors and the personnel thereof, shall
handle with strict and absolute confidentiality, all information directly or indirectly related to
the Company and/or its operations, to which they have access due to or through the rendering of its
services or the performance of the works, and shall not be able to disclose nothing contained in
such confidential information to any person, without the express and written consent of the
Company. Contractor hereby also agrees that the handling and filing of such confidential
information shall be made by applying thereto, at least, the same control, protective measures and
precautions it would apply to handle and file its own data and information.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If for the rendering of the service or for the construction of the works the Company has delivered
confidential information to Contractor, the latter must, once the contract has finished, whether by
expiration of the term or due to any other cause, return all the original documents in its
possession (whether this be in paper or in electronic means) and destroy all the copies in its
possession. On request of the Company, Contractor shall issue a certificate signed by a duly
authorized representative, which shall state that the obligations of restitution and destruction of
the copies mentioned in this paragraph have been complied with.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">22.2 In tune with the most elementary business practices, Contractor shall not pay any commission
or fee whatsoever to employees or officials of the Company, and shall not grant to them, their
relatives or friends, discounts on their possible purchases or personal operations, nor shall it
grant any other type of benefit or courtesy exceeding the limits of what is strictly understood as
elementary courtesy. Compliance with provisions of this clause is considered an essential
obligation of Contractor, the verification of which shall, if applicable, be extended to the
respective Subcontractors. To this end, each agreement entered into with Subcontractors must
contain a reproduction of this clause and the commitment to observe it as
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">regards the Company. The
Company shall be able, with prior notice of three (3)&nbsp;days, to examine the
accounting records and/or books of Contractor, in order to verify compliance with what has been
established in this clause. The same power to be granted in favor of the Company shall be agreed
upon by Contractor with its Subcontractors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>23.&nbsp;Taxes: C</B>ontractor shall strictly perform its tax obligations and shall be subject to the
applicable general taxation legislation. Consequently, it shall fully bear any tax, rate, charge,
expense or right, whether national, provincial or municipal, that may be applicable pursuant to or
in relation with the possible contract or instrumentation or recording thereof, including any
applicable tax or withholding with respect or due to payments or acts performed in compliance
thereof, plus secondary claims and penalties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Payments provided for under the Contract to be instrumented do not include the Value Added Tax
(VAT)&nbsp;to be paid pursuant to what has been established by the competent Argentine authorities in
this issue. The Company shall pay Contractor the amount of such tax against receipt of the invoice
including it, issued in accordance with the applicable provisions in force. Amounts paid for the
VAT may be paid in local currency using the exchange rate in force on the business day immediately
preceding the invoice date.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractor shall indemnify and hold the Company harmless against any cost, damage and injury that
may be claimed against it due to the items previously indicated.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This indemnity obligation must be complied with by Contractor within twenty four (24)&nbsp;hours of a
request made by the Company by sufficient means.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All amounts to be paid due to the stamp tax applied on the contract to be instrumented, should the
same be subject thereto, shall be equally paid by Contractor and the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>24.&nbsp;Domicile. Applicable Law and Jurisdiction: </B>The Company constitutes special domicile for the
purposes of any notice related to the administrative and operational part of the contracting, at
the one established in the Specific Bidding Terms and for court or out-of-court purposes at Leandro
N. Alem 1180, Buenos Aires. Contractor shall constitute special domiciles for the same purposes,
pursuant to what has been established in clause 2(d). Except otherwise provided in each particular
contracting, the applicable law shall be the law of the Republic of Argentina. The parties hereby
submit to the jurisdiction of the local courts of the city of Buenos Aires to solve the disputes
that cannot be solved in good faith directly between them.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>25. Acts of God or Force Majeure:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">25.1 Act of God or Force Majeure shall be: (i)&nbsp;any extraordinary unforeseeable event or (ii)&nbsp;any
extraordinary event which though foreseen, may not have been avoided, provided such extraordinary
unforeseeable or unavoidable events last more than three (3)&nbsp;days. In case of extraordinary events,
sections 513 and other applicable sections of the Argentine Civil Code shall apply.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">25.2 In no event shall Contractor invoke unconscionability, want of skill or commercial
impracticability, in everything related to the contract to be entered into. In no case shall it
attempt to change or terminate the performance of the works or the rendering of the services by
invoking a change in the economic feasibility or in the profitability of the operation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">25.3 <B>Burden of the Proof. </B>Contractor must notify the Company about the occurrence of an event that
may qualify as an Act of God or Force Majeure in the manner and within the term established in
25.4(i). The expiration of such term or the non compliance with the information duties established
shall cause the lapsing of the right to claim such liability exemption(s).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company must issue a decision on the matter within forty eight (48)&nbsp;hours as from the
compliance in the anticipated term of the requirements established in 25.4 (i). If the Company
fails to do so, the cause invoked shall be deemed accepted.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If the event is admitted, the Company shall determine the corresponding extension to be included in
the works schedule.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The granting of a greater term shall be at the exclusive option of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">25.4 If Contractor becomes totally or partially incapable of complying with the obligations of the
contract awarded to it due to an extraordinary event that may qualify as an Act of God or Force
Majeure, its obligations shall be suspended for the time such extraordinary event lasts, to the
extent such event affects it, provided that (i)&nbsp;it notifies in writing the Company of its inability
to perform its obligations due to the extraordinary event of Act of God or Force Majeure, within
forty eight (48)&nbsp;hours of the occurrence thereof, supplying all details on what happened, including
an estimate of the duration thereof and of the probable impact on the performance of its
contractual obligations, and that it continues to inform in a timely and periodical manner on the
situation, as long as such extraordinary event lasts; (ii)&nbsp;it makes its best efforts and adopts all
actions that would be taken by a reasonable and careful Contractor, in accordance with good
customary practice generally accepted for the type of works or service commissioned, in order to
mitigate the consequences of the event and continue complying with its contractual obligations: and
that it continues making its best efforts to cure, with due diligence and good faith, its
performance incapacity; and (iii)&nbsp;it immediately notifies the Company of the cessation of such
extraordinary event of Act of God or Force Majeure, that has been accepted and that has provided it
with an excuse for non performance of its obligations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">25.5 Each party shall separately bear the economic consequences of the event of an Act of God or
Force Majeure, and no additional payment or compensation shall be made by the Company to Contractor
as a result of the suspension of the works or of the rendering of the service attributed to such
Act of God or Force Majeure accepted by the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If the event occurred renders impossible the completion of the works or of the service, the
contract shall be terminated by operation of law. If the consequences of the event force the
stopping of the works or services for the term established in the specific bidding terms of the
contracting, the Company shall be able to terminate the contract. In any one of these two cases,
only works performed shall be paid.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>26. Performance Bond and Labor Obligations</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">26.1 If at any time during the term of the Contract, the payment, financial or credit capacity of
Contractor is affected by any circumstance that might, on the sole judgment of the Company, cause
non compliance by Contractor of any of its obligations under the Contract or Base Documentation
(including, without limitation, the total and full payment of all the Labor Obligations due to its
personnel); Contractor shall, on request of the Company, establish and maintain in force and effect
for the whole term of the Contract and up to the end of any warranty period that may have been
provided for, a performance bond (the &#147;Bond&#148;) for the amount that the Company may reasonably
estimate as adequate to address the pending obligations in charge of Contractor.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Bond may be constituted in cash, in which case an amount of up to ..... % shall be discounted
from each invoice or, in the case of a credit invoice, through the partial acceptance thereof for
the equivalent amount; through a bank guaranty; through listed securities; surety bond or through
other ways, to the entire satisfaction of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Company shall not acknowledge interest on the guaranty deposit, but the interest accrued on the
securities that may be produced shall belong to depositor and shall be at the disposal thereof when
the issuing entity makes them available.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">26.2 Should the above not be complied with by Contractor, the Company shall be entitled to
terminate the Contract by operation of law and Contractor shall have no right to any compensation
for such termination, being the Company able to assign any pending amount to Contractor to the
compliance, on the account and behalf of Contractor, of any pending obligation of Contractor, for
which purpose it is hereby irrevocably authorized.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">26.3 Should any lack of compliance of Contractor be still pending for a term of forty five (45)
days or more, the Company, apart from the other remedies awarded thereto by the Contract, the Base
Documentation and/or the law, shall be able to fully or partially execute the valid bonds, up to
the settlement of the total amounts due or obligations pending performance by Contractor, plus
their respective interest.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>27.&nbsp;Penalties. </B>In case of delays of Contractor in the construction of the works or in the rendering
of the service, pursuant to the works schedule that has been established in the Contract or Base
Documentation, or in the case of repeated non compliance by Contractor of the commissioned tasks,
the Company shall be entitled to apply the penalties to be established in the Specific Bidding
Terms, by operation of law.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The amount resulting from the application of the penalties shall be discounted from the respective
invoices, in case there are invoices of Contractor pending payment, or else shall be directly
required to Contractor, which shall have to pay such amount within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days of the
effective notice by the Company in this respect (with the respective invoice attached thereto) or
deducted from the Bond.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The amount of the penalties to be applied shall not be, per each individual event, lower than {zero
with five percent (0.5%) per day} of the total amount of the Contract, nor higher than,
collectively {twenty percent (20%)} of the total amount of the Contract.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Always subject to the right of the Company to terminate the Contract, the payment of the penalties
shall not release Contractor from its obligations of diligently completing the contracted works or
service or from any other obligation arising from the Contract or the law.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>EXHIBIT 1</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>CONTRACTOR MANAGEMENT SYSTEM</B>

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Health, Safety and Environmental Requirements<BR>
Contractor Liability</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">During the execution of the works, Contractor shall be totally responsible for complying with:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&#062;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> The national, provincial and municipal effective regulations on the issue.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&#062;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> The Company&#146;s internal standards on safety, health and the environment (SSA).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractor shall be totally responsible for the supervision of its personnel in order to assure
compliance with all applicable safety requirements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractor shall appoint one of its employees in the works site to act as safety, health and
environmental advisor, having previously asked the Company for the approval thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">This advisor shall be responsible for coordinating safety, health and environmental activities of
Contractor with the SSA representative of the Company, for all the issues in this area.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Items valid for the present contract are detailed in the attached &#147;Application Lists&#148;.</B>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Occupational Health Requirements</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>1. Legal references</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In this contract, the performance of contractor in Health, Industrial Safety, and
Environmental (HSE)&nbsp;matters shall be subject to the effective legal provisions in the Republic
of Argentina, especially the Occupational Risks Act 24557/95, together with its decrees,
awards and complementary resolutions, Act 20744/ its decrees, resolutions and amendments, Act
19587/72, its Regulatory Decree 351/79, and its Decree 1338/96 and resolution 444/91 on
Health and Occupational Safety (MTSS). Act 24051/91 and its Regulatory Decree 831/93, which
regulates the protection of the environment, Act of the Province of Buenos Aires 11347/92,
Regulatory Decree 450/94 and Amending Decree 403/97, that regulate pathogenic waste,
Industrial Settlement Act of the Province of Buenos Aires 11459/93 and its Regulatory Decree
1601/95. Resolution 157/93 of the National Transportation Secretariat, Act 24241 and Decree
1278/00.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>2. Occupational Health Requirements</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1- As from the bidding stage, contractor shall submit a description of the occupational and
environmental risks of the geographic area referred in the bidding terms as well as of the
activities to be performed. Once the contract is awarded, these occupational and environmental
risks will be reviewed and updated regularly. An identification, evaluation and risk control
system shall be included, to measure variations in the course of
time.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2. Contractor shall present a plan to avoid, reduce and control endemic/epidemic diseases,
specific of the area.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3. Contractor must consider and budget in the bidding stage the following requirements:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3 1. Occupational Health Plan Coordinator
Contractor shall have one (1)&nbsp;Doctor with qualifying degree in Occupational Medicine,
preferably with field experience in the oil or petrochemical industry, knowledgeable in
emergentology and treatment of victims of serious accidents. His/her responsibility will be to
plan and put into practice the activities related to Occupational Health outlined in the
Medical Guide and Procedures Manual of Pan American Energy.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;His/her duties will be to coordinate the activities of the health personnel in the field
(doctors, nurses, paramedics, etc.), to comply with the medical emergencies plan and to assist
the personnel according to what is provided for by law and by Pan American Energy&#146;s own
internal practices.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.2. Field Health Care Personnel
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Given that the works will be carried out in places distant from urban centers, Contractor
must staff permanent health care personnel in the sites mentioned in the Bidding Terms.
Graduated doctors in exercise of their profession shall be needed for works fronts staffed
with more than 200 workers, and these doctors shall be available for emergencies and
consultations. In special high risk cases or areas distant from medical resources, there shall
be a permanent doctor in the drilling site or works front. The background of these doctors
shall include experience in emergentology, critical patients care and evacuation and
occupational medicine knowledge. Graduated nurses are required permanently in those works
fronts when the number of workers exceeds 50 and the risk is low. In works fronts with less
than 50 workers and high risk the presence of a nurse is mandatory while any task is being
performed in the area. The background of these nurses shall include experience in emergency
rooms or intensive care units and in factory infirmaries. Once the contract is awarded, a
continuous education program for emergencies, catastrophes and health preventive issues
(nourishment, diseases, etc.) shall be included.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.3. Occupational medical examinations
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">These examinations must be performed to all individuals work<I>i</I>ng under this contract, in
compliance with Act 24557/95, Resolution SRT 43/97 and PAE&#146;s Health, Industrial Safety and
Environmental Policy. Once the contract is awarded, awardee shall perform the examinations
provided by law to all its employees and shall warrant that its contractors and
subcontractors also do so. The examinations will be pre-occupational risk-oriented
examinations, periodical risk-oriented examinations, pre-position transfer risk-oriented
examinations and pre-termination risk-oriented examinations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.4. Health Promotion Programs :
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The activities outlined in 2.1 shall be detailed in a time schedule. Significance shall be
assigned to the inclusion of programs to prevent: hypoacusia induced by industrial noise,
alcoholism and addiction to other licit and illicit drugs, solar radiation injuries, ionizing
radiation, cold, heat, dust, bad postures and injuries and poisoning caused by chemical
agents. It shall also consider the diagnosis and prevention of diseases transmitted by air,
water and food, inmunopreventible diseases, diseases transmitted by virus, bacteria, insect
stings, scorpions, spiders, animal bites, snakes and sexual transmission diseases.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.5. Recording and statistics:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractor shall document, by means of records and medical statistics, the tasks performed and
shall send to PAE, monthly reports on this activity in equal or similar format to the existing
one in PAE&#146;s Medical Guide and Procedures Manual. All formalities required by Occupational
Hazards Insurance Companies regarding information on accidents and occupational diseases shall
be fulfilled.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3-6. Health care at the works sites:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractor, through its health care personnel, shall provide first aid and evacuation in case
of injuries or occupational and non occupational diseases, to all the personnel at the rig,
and at the works line and front. Contractor shall become familiar with PAE&#146;s medical
emergencies plan and will be part of it. In case medical care is necessary, contractor shall
coordinate such care to be provided at health care centers of low, medium and high complexity
and shall submit a proposal with the chosen centers. Once the contract is awarded, contractor
shall submit a plan of medical emergencies in line with PAE&#146;s plan, which shall have at least:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.6.1. A system for health care and transfer of patients, including communication and
transport means, assigned personnel and referral centers.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.6.2. A first aids brigade, trained in first aid and CPR for each works site with its
respective continuous training program.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.6.3. Updating of Medical Emergencies Plan, being also liable of informing PAE, within 24
hours, about all emergency situations requiring evacuation of injured patients.
Contractor will fulfill all the requirements demanded by its Occupational Hazards Insurance
Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.7. Infrastructure and staff:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Prior to the award, the offeror shall submit a plan to render the following services, which
must be operational simultaneously with the initiation of the works, and having been
previously audited by PAE&#146;s medical and safety personnel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.7.1 Infirmary or aid centers: They shall be equipped to take care of critical patients or
patients with ordinary injuries (oxygen, stretchers, set of instruments, etc.) (Advanced
Trauma Life Support)
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.7.2. Infirmary Elements: Infirmaries will be equipped with elements for cardio pulmonary
urgencies and accidents, suitable to be used by doctors, nurses and paramedics (inflatable
splints for limbs, neck and head immobilizers, intubators, aspirators, ambu laryngeal masks,
sheets for burnt patients, aluminized blankets for patients transport, vacuum mattress, etc.).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.7.3. Transportation: Contractor shall have permanently, at least, one vehicle with cab,
available at each works site for land transportation of patients. The vehicle shall have fire
extinguisher, flashlight, flares and radiophone. Contractor shall also have ambulance services
available, near the operational bases.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.7.4. Medicines: There must be necessary medicines to handle emergencies and common
diseases, which shall be selected by contractor doctors, who will control the stock and
expiration dates of such medicines.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.8. Environmental cleaning and hygiene:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.8.1. Drinking water: Contractor shall plan the supply of drinking water for the workers
following the guidelines described in PAE&#146;s Medical Guide and Procedures Manual.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.8.2. Diners: If the contract includes food services, the guidelines described in PAE&#146;s
Medical Guide and Procedures Manual shall be followed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.8.3. Food manipulators: If the contract includes food services, the guidelines described
in PAE&#146;s Medical Guide and Procedures Manual will be followed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.8.4. Camps Condition: See Camps procedures
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Occupational Hygiene and Safety Requirements</B>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">1</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>SSA Policy</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Planning</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Implementation and operation</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">4.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Checks and corrective actions</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. SSA Policy
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall know, understand, communicate and comply with PAE&#146;s SSA Policy. Offeror must assure
and document compliance thereof at all levels of its organization. During the performance of
contract, the policy shall be fixed in places easily accessible by all personnel.
Should the offeror have a SSA policy, then it shall submit a signed copy thereof for the
corresponding analysis. If it does not have a policy in place, it will indicate so in its offer.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2. Planning
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1. Resources and Personnel
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1.1.Offeror shall warrant, at least, one full time Industrial Safety Coordinator of Contract for
the works sites, and several SSA supervisors depending on the magnitude and risk of the activity.
During the offer study or the performance of the contract, PAE may request adjustments to the
payroll, with the purpose of guaranteeing an appropriate coverage of that task.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1.2. The coordinator must have proven experience in industrial safety, the supervisors or
inspectors must have, at least, the level of a technician in industrial safety.
Offeror shall detail in its offer the resources allocated to the development of the industrial
safety program, such as: budget, communications means, transportation means, training, audio-visual
aids, measurement equipment, personal protection equipment and database to keep safety statistics.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2. Induction, Training, Awareness and Disclosure Program
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2.1. Offeror shall determine the training in SSA which, according to the project, must be
implemented, including in a matrix the personnel to whom it is addressed and an estimation of the
time at which it will be applied.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2.2. Contractor shall also host daily industrial safety briefings, weekly health, safety and
environmental meetings at which the following will be discussed: specific standards of the works to
be executed, unsafe situations identified, and incidents occurred and
lessons learned.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Contractors are responsible for the supply of documentation about training in safety and industrial
hygiene areas for all personnel involved in the project. The instruction will be specific and
applicable to the project. If a mutual agreement is reached, training could be provided by our
company personnel in specific subjects.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2.3. All new personnel in the project must wear, in the sites so requiring, a green helmet so
that all the rest of the personnel is warned that it is a person undergoing training or new in
the works. Once all the training courses are completed and when the supervision deems it
advisable, the previously mentioned helmet color will be replaced by the corresponding one.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All training shall be registered together with the developed subject and filed for its eventual
control.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.2.4. Offeror must also submit its performance goals in industrial safety for the contract,
and identify the actions to be carried out to achieve them. Proactivity indicators (PAE
indicator guidelines may be used) shall be included.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For this purpose, offeror shall have disclosure means such as billboards, pamphlets and
posters aimed at strengthening the positive attitude, knowledge and fulfillment of the
standards and procedures.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror must assimilate any campaign issued or promoted by PAE under this scheme.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3. Risk Administration
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.1. Offeror must present the set of main activities to be performed, and identify and
evaluate the main risks establishing the required control measures. The product of this
analysis shall be submitted as an appendix.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.3.2. Offeror must know and comply with PAE&#146;s Work Permits System .
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.4. Vehicular Safety Program
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.4.1. Vehicular driving and transport management procedures shall be complied with.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.4.2. The operation, revision and maintenance of automotive heavy equipment (cranes, retro
diggers, bulldozers, etc. ) must be part of the same program and, additionally, must include
the safe operation procedures of each equipment in the language of the operator. Moreover, all
equipment required for raising loads (cranes, pipe layers, freight elevators, trucks, hydro
cranes, winch trucks,
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">etc.) must be previously certified by an institution acknowledged by PAE. During the contract
term, equipment must be certified every year. The personnel operating such equipment shall
also be authorized.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.5. Personal Protection Equipment, Elements and Devices
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.5.1. Offeror must submit a plan of provision, use control and replacement of the personal
protection elements for all the workers present at the works site and in accordance with the
identified risks.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.5.2. PAE requires as minimum equipment for each worker, the following:
at construction sites and industrial areas: Safety shoes, boots with safety toe, helmet,
gloves, safety goggles, hearing protectors and those other protection elements required to
perform a safe work according to the identified risks the worker is exposed to.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.&nbsp;Plan Implementation and Operation
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.1. Offeror shall anticipate the inclusion of training resources for the personnel according
to the previously established planning, to wit: didactic material, the site at which the
activity will be performed and the human resources to be employed.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.2. The awardee offeror shall indicate how he will assure that all the personnel:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&#062;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> Understands the SSA policy.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&#062;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> Is trained in the identification of dangers and risks handling</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&#062;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD> Knows its role and responsibility in the SSA plan.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.3. Emergency Response Plan
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall submit a plan indicating the organization, response brigades, available
resources for its execution, communications lines and emergency categories, emergency practice
and training program.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Its personnel shall be linked to the emergency plans of the site and ready to work in the
response brigades if PAE so requires.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall make the medical evacuation plan available in case of an emergency, clearly
indicating in a flow chart the names of the involved personnel and involved medical
institutions, according to the complexity of the emergency.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.4. Reports
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Once the contract is awarded, awardee will monthly su<I>b</I>mit to the PAE representative
reports containing the following data:
</DIV>
<DIV align="center">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In case of need a complete definitions guide can be found in the SSA correct handling document
(Getting HSE Right).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4. Verification and Corrective Actions
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.1. Inspections Plan
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.1.1 Offeror must submit an inspections plan to evaluate the administrative management in
industrial safety, including the methodology description, the participants, the performance
intervals and the recommendations follow up.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It must also provide information about its own equipment and tools maintenance inspections,
according to the preventive maintenance programs.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.2. Contractor shall be in charge of industrial hygiene monitoring in the works environment of
its employees, with the purpose of verifying that they are suitably protected in those areas
where a potential exposure to chemical products, biological and/or physical agents exists. Our
company will inform contractors at the works place, about any dangerous condition existing
therein, with the purpose of assisting them in the identification of these conditions in the
cases where monitoring is required. If contractors do not have the capacity to perform such
task, they will have to contract the services of a qualified consultant or to obtain the
services of specialized companies.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.3. Investigation and Incident Reporting System
Offeror must submit its investigation and incident reporting system, and it must also attach
an investigated accident case with the respective causes and established recommendations.
Once the contract is awarded, offeror shall be able to use PAE&#146;s incident investigation guide
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4. Plan Audit
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.1. Offeror shall propose a revision of the plan designed for the project with the purpose
of an early identification of deviations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.2. The resulting non conformities will be listed and terms and individuals in charge to
perform the corrective actions will be established.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>Environmental Requirements</B><BR>
General Aspects

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE has a ISO 14001 certified Environmental Management System (EMS), where the activities of
offerors are included.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Should the offeror be awarded the works, it shall comply with PAE&#146;s EMS. A copy of said document is
available on request.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1.&nbsp;Environmental Management Plan for the Project
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Environmental Management Plan for the Project is the Document the offeror must include in its
bid. The offeror must include all the activities it needs to carry out in the development of the
project, and shall only include the list of the relevant building and operative procedures
involving the management of Significant Environmental Aspects following the procedural
identification criterion of PAE&#146;s environmental aspects.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.&nbsp;Environmental Policy
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror must know, understand, communicate and comply with PAE&#146;s Environmental Policy. Offeror must
ensure and produce evidence of compliance with said Policy at all levels of its organization.
During the performance of the contract, the policy must be fixed in places easily accessible by all
the personnel.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2.1. Offeror must present its environmental policy or the environmental policy proposed for the
development of the activity.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.&nbsp;Planning
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">According to the complexity of the project, the full or partial compliance with the items described
below shall be determined in the particular conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.1 Identification of environmental Aspects: it must know the Environmental Aspects of PAE&#146;s EMS
and identify and control the Significant Environmental Aspects &#150; SEA&#150; originated by its operations.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.2 Legal Requirements: it must know, understand and comply with the Legal Requirements established
by PAE in the EMS as well as in the specific Licenses and Permits for the project and others to be
applied.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.3 Objectives and goals: all PAE&#146;s EMS objectives and goals which are related to its activities
have to be known and all Objectives and Goals arising from the spotted Significant Environmental
Aspects must be established.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3.4 Environmental Management programs: it must know, apply and/or design and execute all
Environmental Administration Programs (or of environmental management) related to the Objectives
and Goals identified, ensuring compliance thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror must summarily and schematically present the environmental administration or management
programs according to the objectives and goals identified by offeror according to the Environmental
Management Plan elaborated by PAE, applicable to its work or service.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.&nbsp;Implementation and Operation
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.1 Structure and Liability
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall implement, keep and operate its Environmental Management, under the following
conditions:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.3 Establishment of an organizational structure.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.4 Submission of the proposed Environmental Management System organizational chart.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.5 Align its Environmental Management System with that of PAE&#146;s
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Ensure compliance with PAE&#146;s environmental policy
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.4.6 According to the complexity, it shall contemplate the appointment of a person who will be
responsible of the environmental area and who shall be custodian of the environmental management
elements.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.5 Training, awareness and competence
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.5.1 It shall define and execute a training program to ensure: knowledge on environmental
management (and its relation with PAE&#146;s EMS), competence of the personnel managing Significant
Environmental Aspects (significantly impacting or that may impact on the environment) and that said
personnel is aware of and applies the operational procedures related to its activity.
Offeror shall submit its proposed training program through a matrix.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.6 Communications System
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">It shall establish and keep a communications system on the environmental management System and
agreed upon with PAE.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall summarily submit the proposal or scheme of communication of the relevant aspects of
the environmental management.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.7. Control of Documentation
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A Control, Management and Distribution system of the environmental management documents shall be
defined and applied, consistent with PAE&#146;s EMS.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall comply with the list of operational control procedures according to the EMS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4.8. Prevention and response to an emergency
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">PAE&#146;s Contingency Plan shall be known and understood.
</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror is required to include the proposal to meet this Plan in the training matrix requested, as
well as to include the management of environmental emergencies in the environmental administration
programs.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.&nbsp;Verification and Corrective Actions
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.1. Monitoring and Measurement: Offeror shall comply with the procedure to perform monitoring and
measurement of the characteristics that are inherent to its operations and activities to ensure a
correct environmental management consistent with EMS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All equipment and instruments that form part of the system for monitoring and measuring variables
associated to significant environmental aspects must be calibrated and the appropriate maintenance
implemented. These two activities must be registered.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Non-conformities and Corrective and Preventive Actions: Offeror must set up a plan to correct
identified non-conformities. Corrective and preventive actions must be verifiable and timely
informed to PAE. A copy of the verification and issuance/closure report of non-conformities must be
available for its control by PAE.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror must include in its proposal the performance verification system, the way corrective
actions shall be handled and how the closure shall be verified.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Issuance
and Control of Environmental Registries</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The list of registries shall be delivered to PAE to make it official within the system.
Additionally, the list of significant environmental procedures of the activity to be carried out
shall be included.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The registries to be generated shall be consistent with the respective procedure and shall be sent
to PAE within the terms specified for said procedure.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.2 EMS Auditing
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror authorizes PAE to audit and inspect, at any time, all equipment, work sites, personnel and
documents that are necessary to evaluate the compliance and application of EMS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall present its proposal of the internal audit program to be performed during the
execution of the works.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.3 Revision by the Management
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The documents generated after auditing shall be revised by PAE&#146;s management. Offeror shall submit
the management revision program proposed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.4 EMS&#146;s Formats
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror may design, develop and document its procedure and registries by using as a basis those
established in PAE&#146;s EMS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.5 Improvement of EMS
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror may suggest and recommend practices and/or procedures aiming at continuing improving the
EMS.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.6 Induction Meeting
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Before the starting-up of activities, the management and the supervisory personnel of Offeror shall
participate in an induction meeting of SSA.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The purpose of the meeting shall be to clarify doubts and to reaffirm knowledge and commitment in
the execution of the Environmental Management Plan by Offeror with the following general agenda:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>PAE&#146;s environmental policy</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>EMS</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Legal considerations</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Indications regarding the Environmental Management Plan of the Project</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>General Environmental Requirements</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><font face="wingdings">&#216;</font></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Specific Rules on Environmental Compliance</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">



</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>As it applies to the object of service/activity to hire</U>, the following rules and guidelines
of actions shall be taken into account by Offeror and its employees:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Damage to third parties caused by non-compliance with these rules is the responsibility of OFFEROR,
who shall have to cure said damage at its cost.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">As a measure of protection of wildlife, bearing and using arms in the area of work is prohibited,
except for the safety personnel who is expressly authorized to do so.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mobile equipment, including heavy machinery, shall be operated so that minimum deterioration to
soil, vegetation and streams of the works site is caused. The washing of mobile equipment shall not
be made in gap beds or in other sites different from the areas
authorized in the works site. Provisioning of fuel and maintenance of mobile equipment and other machinery, including washing
works, shall be carried out in a way so as not to pollute soils or waters and waste shall be
retained and treated. The location of the yards to carry out these operations shall be isolated
from the streams.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall keep in good operative conditions all its machinery with the aim of avoiding
lubricant or fuel leaks that may affect soils, streams, air and organisms.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Motor-pumps, and in general water-extraction equipment to be installed at a stream bank shall be
supplied with trays to allow avoidance of fuel and lubricants leaks. By no means shall oils or
fuels be discharged to a water body or soil.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Used oils and lubricants and cleaning and maintenance residues shall be retained in hermetic
containers and shall be treated and have an appropriate final disposal.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All camps shall be supplied with facilities for recollection, treatment and disposition of waste
water, which systems shall have to be previously authorized by PAE. Solid waste shall be handled
pursuant to PAE&#146;s standards.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall ensure that the impact on vegetation or the deforestation is the minimum necessary to
carry out the works, for which purposes they shall have the relevant permits.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Deforestation and cutting waste must not reach streams. Said waste must be piled up so that no
imbalance in the conditions of the area is caused. Except in cases that are justified by PAE and
authorities of the administration of woods, protected forests, etc. said waste shall not be burned.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In the land movement operations, Offeror shall implement all control measures regarding the
materials waste in order not to cause land slips in the surrounding area and pollution of streams.
A previous plan has to be in place to dispose inert waste and to store the vegetal layer to later
restore the landscape (restoration of vegetation, corrective land movements, etc.) The works
oriented to the management of rain water must be carried out before the land movement has started.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">When ditches or trenches of a work directly meet in a surface water source, they shall be provided
with appropriate infrastructure to allow sediment decantation.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Drainage must be built following level curves towards natural protected channels. Should this not
be possible, energy dissipation structures must be built.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">When it is necessary to deviate a natural stream or when a transitory path has been built for a
stream and these works shall not to be necessary in the future, the abandoned stream or the path
shall be restored by Offeror to its original conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall install tubes and/or hoses provisionally, depending on the output to be handled, in
drainages and runoffs interrupted by the construction of paths.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Broken-stone or bed particles shall not be removed from the river, brook beds, beaches, lakes or
small lakes, except in areas specifically approved as sources of material by the competent
governmental entity and in this case the deterioration of the area at the end of the use shall be
avoided, and it shall carry out works that are necessary for the
recovery of the affected area.</div>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall take all steps necessary to ensure that cement, mud or fresh concrete, and in general
solid residues, are not received, at the end, by the stream beds.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Excavation or path opening material shall be piled up for its use in restoring the landscape when
works are not permanent.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Offeror shall put special attention to maintain fences, enclosures and accesses, which shall remain
closed at all moments and demand from its sub-contractors the observance of this obligation.
The adequate disposition of waste water shall be permanently verified.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In camp areas all natural and artificial rain water drainage and gutters have to be clean.
Offeror shall be obliged to cooperate so that the behavior of its workers is an example for the
community.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">At the end of the activities, the work areas shall be left in similar conditions to those initially
found.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All hydrocarbons handling activity shall have preventive and control measures for leaks.
Hunting, consumption, transport or holding of wildlife animals or breeding animals is prohibited.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Regarding the protection of historical and cultural resources, Offeror is obliged to take into
account the following recommendations if a site with archeological remains is found:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Do not allow the destruction of remains and elements.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Avoid publication so that robbery or site alteration is prevented.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="1%" nowrap align="left"><B>&#150;</B></TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Transitorily suspend works in the site and immediately contact PAE&#146;s representative.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5.7 Reports
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If awarded the works, Offeror shall inform PAE&#146;s representative, within two hours of produced, of
any news related to the actual or potential environmental damage.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Other data shall be monthly sent to the inspection of PAE or to whom PAE may specifically indicate.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>DRILLING APPLICATION LIST</B>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Occupational Health</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center">

    <TD align="center" valign="top">YES</TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="center" valign="top">YES</TD>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.14
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>h42364exv10w14.htm
<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENT NO.1 TO STRATEGIC AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w14</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Exhibit&nbsp;10.14
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>DLS Argentina Limited</B><BR>
SUCURSAL ARGENTINA

</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">City of Buenos Aires, April&nbsp;1, 2005
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Messrs.<BR>
Pan American Energy LLC Sucursal Argentina (<I>Argentine Branch</I>)<BR>
Av. Leandro N. Alem 1180<BR>
(1001)&nbsp;Buenos Aires<BR>
<U>By hand</U>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>Re</U>: Strategic Agreement for the rendering of Drilling, Completion and Workover Services of
oil and gas wells. Amendment # 1.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Dear Sirs,
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">We hereby submit to your consideration our sole amendment proposal (the &#147;Amendment&#148;) to the
Strategic Agreement for the rendering of Drilling, Completion and Workover Services of wells
located in the area of the Gulf of San Jorge, Provinces of Chubut and Santa Cruz, and other related
services transcribed in our note dated July&nbsp;1, 2003, the text of which is transcribed herein below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All capitalized terms used in this Amendment that have not been expressly defined shall have the
meaning assigned to them by the Strategic Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">WHEREAS, taking into account the changes in prices and costs verified in the local market, it is
the PARTIES intention to adjust the tariffs and work modalities set forth by the Strategic
Agreement;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">THEREFORE the PARTIES agree to execute this Amendment under the following terms:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>1. PARTIES</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">DLS Argentina Limited &#150; Sucursal Argentina, with legal domicile at Sarmiento 663, City of Buenos
Aires, hereinafter referred to as &#147;DLS&#148; and PAN AMERICAN ENERGY LLC &#150; Sucursal Argentina, with
legal domicile at Av. Leandro N. Alem 1180 of the City of Buenos Aires, hereinafter referred to as
&#147;PAE&#148;, (both parties jointly referred to as the &#147;PARTIES&#148; and individually as &#147;PARTY&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>2. PURPOSE</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The purpose of this Amendment is to adjust the tariffs that DLS shall be entitled to charge for the
SERVICES, as established in Appendix&nbsp;I to the present offer. Such new prices and conditions shall
apply to the SERVICES rendered as from January&nbsp;1, 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">In addition, and taking into account that the cost variations begun during the second semester of
2004, PAE acknowledges that DLS is entitled to an amount of US$570,000.00 (five hundred and seventy
thousand US Dollars) plus the corresponding VAT, covering all sums due, which DLS declares
sufficient so as to cover any eventual additional cost incurred up to January&nbsp;1, 2005. DLS shall
invoice this amount and PAE shall pay it within 30 (thirty)&nbsp;days following reception of the
invoice.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>3. RENDERING OF THE SERVICES</U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Services that constitute the subject matter of this Agreement shall be rendered exclusively to
the extent to which they are required by PAE and in the amount determined by the latter, in
accordance with the guidelines set forth by the Strategic Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><U>4. RATIFICATION</U>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">All terms and conditions not expressly amended by the present Amendment shall continue to be
governed by the Strategic Agreement, whose terms and conditions are deemed to be reproduced herein
and ratified to all effects.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The present offer shall be considered accepted by you when Pan American Energy LLC (Sucursal
Argentina) pays the Invoice 0001-00001445 that DLS Limited Argentina (Sucursal Argentina) shall
present on April&nbsp;18, 2005, for the amount established in the second paragraph of Clause 2 of the
present Amendment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">For the purposes of this Amendment the payment date shall be considered as the &#147;Effective Date&#148; of
the Amendment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Sincerely,
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">/s/ Mart&#237;n Z&#246;ldi
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Mart&#237;n Z&#246;ldi<BR>
Vice President

</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><U><B>Appendix&nbsp;I</B></U>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

</TR>

</DIV>

PRICES&#148; of the Strategic Agreement shall be modified as follows:
</DIV>

</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">b.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In case that during a well completion more than 32.4 hours are employed in well
logging operations, in addition to the global amount &#147;<B><I>LS</I></B>&#148; payable per completed well, an
extra amount shall be payable, which shall be determined as follows:</TD>
</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD><B><I>H1 </I></B>x <B><I>SHR </I></B>x <B><I>H2 </I></B>x <B><I>OHR</I></B></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD>Where:</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD width="1%"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></TD>
    <TD><B><I>H1 </I></B>= hours of logging exceeding the first 32.4 and up to a maximum of 48 hours in whole</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>

</TR>

<TR>

    <TD width="2%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>

<DESCRIPTION>AMENDMENT NO.2 TO STRATEGIC AGREEMENT
<TEXT>
